           THIRD READING                      
         CONSENT CALENDAR                     
       Mr. Wessels moved for third reading and
 final passage of Board Bills No. 5.          
      Seconded by Mr. Ortmann.                
      Carried by the following vote:          
       Ayes: Troupe, Flowers, Bosley, Moore,  
 Hubbard, Triplett, Young, Ortmann, Vollmer,  
 Villa, Wessels, Howard, Florida, Baringer,   
 Kennedy, Davis, French, Vaccaro, Ogilvie,    
 Cohn and President Reed. 21                  
      Noes: 0                                 
      Present: 0                              
              Board Bill No. 5                
      An ordinance designating certain real   
 property located within the City of St. Louis
 as part of Minnie Wood Park.                 
   THIRD READING, REPORT OF                   
 THE ENGROSSMENT COMMITTEE                    
      AND FINAL PASSAGE                       
        OF BOARD BILLS                        
      None.                                   
         REPORT OF THE                        
     ENROLLMENT COMMITTEE                     
      Board of Aldermen, Committee Report,    
 St. Louis, September 14, 2012.               
      To the President of the Board of        
 Aldermen:                                    
      The Committee on Engrossed and          
 Enrolled Bills to whom was referred the      
 following Board Bill report that they have   
considered the same and it is truly enrolled.   
            Board Bill No. 5                    
     An ordinance designating certain real      
property located within the City of St. Louis   
as part of Minnie Wood Park.                    
     Alderman Vollmer                           
     Chairman of the Committee                  
      Board Bill Numbered 5 was read and all    
other business being suspended, Mr. Reed, in    
the presence of the Board and in open session,  
affixed his signature in accordance with the    
provisions of the Charter.                      
     COURTESY RESOLUTIONS                       
       CONSENT CALENDAR                         
      President Reed introduced Resolutions     
No. 87 through 127 and the Clerk was            
instructed to read same.                        
           Resolution No. 87                    
               Jo Ann Vatcha                    
      WHEREAS, the many ways in which           
Jo Ann Vatcha has made our City a better        
place to live, work and play are too numerous   
to recount in total; and                        
     WHEREAS, Jo Ann and her husband            
Neville were pioneers in the revitalization of  
the Skinker-DeBaliviere neighborhood; and       
     WHEREAS, Jo Ann began working on           
The Times of Skinker-DeBaliviere in 1974,       
served as editor and with her husband Neville   
held many backyard parties/fundraisers for      
the paper; and                                  
     WHEREAS, In 1989 Jo Ann assumed            
the chair of the Commercial Committee,          
known as the Delmar Committee,                  
spearheading the redevelopment of the East      
Loop; and                                       
     WHEREAS, Jo Ann authored a history         
of Skinker- DeBaliviere for the neighborhood    
centennial in 2008; and                         
     WHEREAS, Jo Ann was a schoolteacher        
and later headed the St. Louis affiliate of     
Neighborhood Housing Services before being      
hired by Operation Impact in 1991; and          
     WHEREAS, Jo Ann led Operation              
Impact's Hope 3 revitalization program as a     
housing analyst and spurred the                 
redevelopment of many city neighborhoods        
using Hope 3, Community Development             
Block Grant and other federal, state and local  
resources and tools; and                        
     WHEREAS, in 1999, as part of a             
reorganization of the City's development        
agencies, Jo Ann became a housing analyst at    
the       Community         Development         
Administration; and                             
      WHEREAS, Jo Ann has worked                       
 especially closely with the Benton Park,              
 Benton Park West, Shaw and Penrose                    
 neighborhoods and the housing corporations            
 serving them; and                                     
      WHEREAS, Jo Ann has greatly                      
 furthered neighborhood stabilization and              
 revitalization, housing investment and                
 community pride, building networks of                 
 concerned and knowledgeable neighbors,                
 developers, investors and property owners;            
 and                                                   
      WHEREAS, Jo Ann will begin her well-             
 earned retirement on August 1, 2012; and              
       WHEREAS, Jo Ann made this decision              
 at the urging of her husband Neville, her             
 daughters Chanaya and Dina, their husbands,           
 her grandchildren, and many friends who want          
 to enjoy more time with her; and                      
      WHEREAS, Jo Ann made this decision               
 despite pleading from her co-workers and              
 clients in city government and in                     
 neighborhoods throughout the City; and,               
      WHEREAS, Jo Ann will be greatly                  
 missed by her CDA colleagues, her friends at          
 the Board of Alderman and by those                    
 throughout City government and in the                 
 neighbors where she has worked so                     
 successfully.                                         
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                             
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of                  
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our            
 deliberations to thank and congratulate Jo Ann        
 Vatcha for her many years of service to the           
 City and citizens of St. Louis and we wish her        
 peace and happiness in her retirement and we          
 direct the Clerk of this Board to spread a copy       
 of this Resolution across the minutes of these        
 proceedings and to further prepare a                  
 commemorative copy to the end that it may             
 be presented to our honoree at a time and             
 place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.              
 Introduced on the 14th day of September, 2012         
 by:                                                   
 Honorable KennethA. Ortmann,Alderman 9thWard          
 Honorable Lewis E. Reed, President, Board ofAldermen  
 Honorable Charles QuincyTroupe,Alderman 1st Ward      
 Honorable Dionne Flowers,Alderwoman 2nd Ward          
 Honorable Freeman Bosley, Sr.,Alderman 3rd Ward       
 Honorable Samuel L. Moore,Alderman 4th Ward           
 HonorableTammika Hubbard,Alderwoman 5th Ward          
 Honorable Kacie S. Triplett,Alderwoman 6th Ward       
 Honorable Phyllis Young,Alderwoman 7th Ward           
 Honorable Stephen J. Conway,Alderman 8th Ward         
 Honorable KennethA. Ortmann,Alderman 9th Ward         
 Honorable Joseph Vollmer,Alderman 10th Ward           
 Honorable ThomasAlbert Villa,Alderman 11th Ward       
 Honorable LarryArnowitz,Alderman 12th Ward            
 HonorableAlfred Wessels, Jr.,Alderman 13thWard 
 Honorable Carol J. Howard,Alderwoman 14th Ward 
 Honorable Jennifer Florida,Alderwoman 15th Ward
 Honorable Donna Baringer,Alderwoman 16th Ward  
 Honorable Joseph Roddy,Alderman 17th Ward      
 Honorable Terry Kennedy,Alderman 18th Ward     
 Honorable Marlene Davis,Alderwoman 19th Ward   
 Honorable Craig Schmid,Alderman 20th Ward      
 HonorableAntonio D. French,Alderman 21st Ward  
 Honorable Jeffrey L. Boyd,Alderman 22nd Ward   
 Honorable Joseph Vaccaro,Alderman 23rd Ward    
 Honorable Scott Ogilvie,Alderman 24th Ward     
 Honorable Shane Cohn,Alderman 25th Ward        
 Honorable Frank Williamson,Alderman 26th Ward  
 Honorable Lyda Krewson,Alderwoman 28th Ward    
            Resolution No. 88                   
             Antionette Cousins                 
       WHEREAS, Mrs. Antionette Cousins         
 is a native St. Louisan, born and raised in the
 community she serves. She has been married     
 for over ten years to her college sweetheart,  
 Lieutenant Ryan Cousins and is mother to a     
 son, Ryan, and daughter Addison; and           
     WHEREAS, She attended National             
 Louis University where she received her        
 Master of Science in Human Resource            
 Management & Development. She also has a       
 Bachelors of Science in Social Work at Central 
 Missouri State University. She is a proud      
 member of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc.;    
 and                                            
      WHEREAS, In June 2002 Mrs. Cousins        
 began her journey with Riverview West          
 Florissant Development Corporation. Since      
 then she has developed over 75 units of new    
 and rehab housing; and                         
       WHEREAS, she has created and             
 implemented several programs to include        
 TMAP nuisance program, Beautification          
 Lawn Care Program and the Handyman/            
 Critical Property Repair (CPR) home repair     
 programs. She directs the day-to-day           
 operations of the organization and oversees    
 and assumes ultimate responsibilities for the  
 effective planning and implementation of the   
 initiatives, programs and business             
 opportunities developed by the association.    
 She provides corporate leadership, strategic   
 direction and an irrefutable management        
 structure; and                                 
      WHEREAS, she serves as a well-            
 respected source of information and insight    
 with local and national funders, political     
 leaders, and the business and civic            
 organizations. She is accountable to the Board 
 of Directors and conducts all duties and       
 responsibilities and authorities associated    
 with being executive officer of a non-profit   
 corporation; and                               
      WHEREAS, Mrs. Cousins is a forward          
thinking visionary, who works tirelessly to       
develop new concepts in the mission to serve      
the residents of the North side of the City of    
St. Louis. No problem is too small, no resident   
is unimportant, she leaves no stone unturned;     
and                                               
      WHEREAS, because of Mrs. Cousins'           
attributes, Riverview West Florissant             
Development Corporation has earned its            
immaculate track record in conducting the         
business of improving the overall conditions      
of the area.                                      
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                         
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of              
the City of St. Louis that we pause in our        
deliberations to recognize the many               
contributions of Antionette Cousins and we        
direct the Clerk of this Board to spread a copy   
of this Resolution across the minutes of these    
proceedings and to further prepare a              
commemorative copy to the end that it may         
be presented to our honoree at a time and         
place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.          
Introduced on the 16th day of July, 2012 by:      
Honorable Dionne Flowers,Alderwoman 2nd Ward      
Honorable Gregory J. Carter,Alderman 27th Ward    
           Resolution No. 89                      
             Betty Jean Kerr                      
        People's Health Centers                   
     WHEREAS, the Betty Jean Kerr                 
People's Health Center (PHC) is celebrating       
40 years of service to the community; and         
     WHEREAS, in 1972 medical students,           
physicians and community activists started        
People's Health Center and in 1979 Betty Jean     
Kerr was recruited to lead those efforts; and     
     WHEREAS, over the years, Betty Jean          
Kerr and staff developed sustained                
partnerships with the goal of helping patients    
manage their health; and                          
      WHEREAS, the Health Centers' 40th           
anniversary is structured around four pillars     
of success: community, compassion,                
commitment and custodians of care. These          
same four pillars are represented in the staffs'  
daily activities; and                             
      WHEREAS, People's Health Center             
provides a comprehensive array of health          
services in pediatrics, obstetrics, internal      
medicine, gynecology, dentistry, podiatry,        
ultrasound services, pharmacy and laboratory      
services; and                                     
     WHEREAS, in addition, People's               
Health Center provides behavioral health,         
substance abuse services and family life          
enrichment to meet the needs of the citizens;     
 and                                                   
      WHEREAS, the mission of Betty Jean               
 Kerr People's Health Center is to improve             
 the health status and quality of life for all         
 residents in the St. Louis metropolitan               
 community by providing comprehensive                  
 primary health care along with related services       
 directly and through collaborations and               
 partnerships.                                         
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                             
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of                  
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our            
 deliberations to recognize the staff of Betty         
 Jean Kerr People's Health Centers for their           
 40 years of dedicated service to the                  
 community and wish them continued success             
 at providing essential health services to the         
 community. We further direct the Clerk of this        
 Board to spread a copy of this Resolution             
 across the minutes of these proceedings and           
 to prepare a commemorative copy to the end            
 that it may be presented to our honoree at a          
 time and place deemed appropriate by the              
 Sponsor.                                              
 Introduced on the 20th day of July, 2012 by:          
 Honorable Frank Williamson,Alderman 26th Ward         
 Honorable Lewis E. Reed, President, Board ofAldermen  
             Resolution No. 90                         
        Elder Ronald Elliot Haynes                     
      WHEREAS, Elder Ronald Elliot Haynes              
 has been a life-long resident of St. Louis,           
 Missouri, a faithful member and humble                
 servant of San Francisco Temple Christian             
 Assembly and the community. He has                    
 performed in many capacities the church and           
 community under the leadership of the Late            
 Bishop Dwight H. McDaniels, Jr. and their             
 current leader Bishop Luther J. Blackwell, Jr;        
 and                                                   
       WHEREAS, he currently serves as                 
 Executive Elder which necessitates him to             
 maintain and oversee all credentials bearers          
 such as Elders, Ministers, Evangelists,               
 Missionaries, and Office Executives. He               
 designed the certification documents and              
 identification cards. He acquires and provides        
 the pictures for the identification documents         
 as well; and                                          
      WHEREAS, as a phenomenal teacher,                
 Ronald E. Haynes has taught generations of            
 families, parents, children and even                  
 grandchildren. He has no respect of person            
 when it comes to children. He has taught and          
 provided enrichment opportunities for                 
 handicap children throughout the community,           
 teaching them the only limits they have are           
 the ones they set for themselves. As a mentor,        
 he has embraced generations of the human race.        
 He delivers a risk free environment for his           
 mentees to take the necessary risks in order     
 to move forward and face life's challenges;      
 and                                              
      WHEREAS, his meek and humble spirit         
 afforded him the opportunity to serve as an      
 Armor-Bearer for the Late Bishop Dwight H.       
 McDaniels, Jr. for over 30 years. His grace      
 and humility is why those whom he sheltered      
 always experienced a sense of comfort because    
 he did just that, provided a safe haven; and     
       WHEREAS, a master photographer is          
 just among his many triumphs. By reputation,     
 he is consistently sought after to provide       
 photographic services to families, friends, and  
 colleagues; and                                  
      WHEREAS, he is an astonishing               
 archivist, he has managed to archive special     
 pictures, programs, artifacts and much more      
 that most find exceptional. He is able to        
 articulate and solidify his archives with        
 supporting documents without reproach; and       
       WHEREAS, he has been a remarkable          
 Sunday School Instructor for over 30 years       
 while mentoring others to become one. With a     
 heart for the youth, he was ordained to be an    
 YPWW instructor (Young People Willing            
 Workers). Eventually he was promoted to          
 Superintendent because of his constancy,         
 commitment and in-depth knowledge of the         
 Bible; and                                       
      WHEREAS, Elder Ronald Haynes has            
 designed 100% of the church's logos. He is       
 responsible for the logo designs of other        
 organizations as well. He is the project         
 manager for the entire process for all of the    
 organization's signs from design to installation.
 As a Design Director, Ron Haynes continues       
 to coordinate and critiques' all graphics and    
 designs that are present to the organization;    
 and                                              
       WHEREAS, Elder Ronald Elliot Haynes        
 has accomplished much, such as BA & MA           
 Degrees in Education. He's an accomplished       
 athlete, historian, artist and master            
 photographer. Elder Ronald Elliot Haynes         
 retired from being a master educator after 37    
 years, but not from being a life-long teacher.   
 For his unconditional and relentless devotion    
 to teaching life skills and life lessons.        
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                        
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of             
 the City of St. Louis, that we pause in our      
 deliberations to recognize the many              
 contributions of Elder Ronald Elliot Haynes      
 and we further direct the Clerk of this Board    
 to spread a copy of this Resolution across the   
 minutes of these proceedings and to further      
 prepare a commemorative copy to the end          
 that it may be presented to our honoree at a     
time and place deemed appropriate by the              
Sponsor.                                              
Introduced on the 20th day of July, 2012 by           
Honorable Gregory J. Carter,Alderman 27th Ward        
            Resolution No. 91                         
            UniverSoul Circus                         
     WHEREAS, UniverSoul Circus has                   
brought many hours of enjoyment to countless          
numbers of families; and                              
     WHEREAS, UniverSoul Circus will be               
performed under the "big top" in St. Louis            
from July 24th to July 29th; and                      
      WHEREAS, the McDonald's Family of               
Restaurants of St. Louis is a proud sponsor           
of the St. Louis Missouri UniverSoul Circus           
tour; and                                             
       WHEREAS, this year's production                
titled "US" includes 14 outstanding acts from         
Europe, Asia, Africa, United States, all coming       
together to create an unforgettable global            
experience; and                                       
      WHEREAS, UniverSoul is a highly                 
interactive combination of circus arts, theater,      
music that spans genres including Pop, Classic        
R & B, Latin, Hip Hop, Jazz, Gospel; and              
      WHEREAS, the circus will perform over           
500 shows in 27 major markets. The                    
international cast includes 80 world-class            
acrobats, contortionists, aerialists, martial         
artists, dancers, comedians, clowns, horses,          
tigers, elephants; and                                
     WHEREAS, UniverSoul's fresh                      
approach to family friendly entertainment has         
earned them a coveted spot as one of                  
Ticketmaster's top ten most requested family          
events.                                               
     NOW THEREFORE BE IT                              
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of                  
the City of St. Louis that we pause in our            
deliberations to recognize Cedric Walker and          
the staff of UniverSoul Circus for their              
exciting, exhilarating, captivating, heart            
stopping, hand clapping 2012 UniverSoul               
Circus. We wish them continued success at             
bringing plenty of laughs and excellent               
entertainment to the other cities they visit.         
We further direct the Clerk of this Board to          
spread a copy of this Resolution across the           
minutes of these proceedings and to prepare a         
commemorative copy to the end that it may             
be presented to our honoree at a time and             
place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.              
Introduced on the 20h day of July, 2012.              
HonorableTerry Kennedy,Alderman 18th Ward             
Honorable Lewis E. Reed, President, Board ofAldermen  
Honorable Charles QuincyTroupe,Alderman 1stWard       
 Honorable Dionne Flowers,Alderwoman 2nd Ward      
 Honorable Freeman Bosley, Sr.,Alderman 3rd Ward   
 Honorable Samuel L. Moore,Alderman 4th Ward       
 HonorableTammika Hubbard,Alderwoman 5thWard       
 Honorable Kacie StarrTriplett,Alderwoman 6thWard  
 Honorable Marlene E. Davis,Alderwoman 19th Ward   
 HonorableAntonio D. French,Alderman 21st Ward     
 Honorable Jeffrey L. Boyd,Alderman 22nd Ward      
 Honorable Frank Williamson,Alderman 26th Ward     
 Honorable Gregory J. Carter,Alderman 27th Ward    
            Resolution No. 92                      
       Deacon Richard Sanders, Jr.                 
       WHEREAS, Deacon Richard Sanders,            
 Jr. was born on Tuesday, July 20, 1911 in         
 Vaughn, Mississippi to Richard, Sr. and           
 Missionary Joanna Sanders, Assistant State        
 Mother of Northern Mississippi, Church Of         
 God In Christ, under the late State Bishop        
 B.S. Lyles. Richard was the first son born to     
 this union, thereby acquiring the name, Richard   
 (Son) Sanders, Jr.; the second child of 5 sons    
 and 2 daughters born to this household.           
 Preceding him in death were all 4 brothers,       
 Alonzo, Timothy, Mavis (Bill), and                
 Wellington (Bay), and one sister, Olivia          
 Sanders Ingram. He accepted Christ in 1927        
 at the age of 16; and                             
       WHEREAS, Richard Sanders, Jr. was           
 united in holy matrimony to Inez Miller on        
 December 28, 1932. To this union were born        
 ten children, eight sons and two daughters.       
 Preceding him in death were his beloved wife      
 of 73 years, one son, the former Prelate of       
 Eastern Missouri & Western Illinois, Church       
 Of God In Christ, Bishop W. Wesley Sanders,       
 who pastored Shiloh Church Of God In Christ       
 for 31 years, where Dad Sanders was the first     
 recorded Deacon and Trustee. Also preceding       
 him in death were one daughter, First Lady        
 Vernetta Jefferson, and three grandchildren,      
 one of whom preceded him just hours before;       
 and                                               
       WHEREAS, Richard Sanders, Jr. was           
 born into the second generation of holiness of    
 the Church Of God In Christ. He and his family    
 relocated from Vaughn to Lexington,               
 Mississippi and united with St. Paul Church       
 Of God In Christ, Bishop Charles H. Mason's       
 first church, under the leadership of Elder       
 W.A. Patterson. In 1943, Dad Sanders, along       
 with his family moved to St. Louis, Missouri      
 and united with Williams Temple Church Of         
 God In Christ, under the late Bishop              
 Columbus Williams. He was a dedicated             
 worker in the Sunday School, Young People's       
 Willing Workers (YPWW), on the Usher              
 Board and Deacon's Board. In 1969, Dad            
 Sanders moved his membership to Shiloh            
 Church Of God In Christ, the new work             
 started by his son, the late Bishop W. Wesley     
 Sanders. Dad not only served in the               
 administration of the work, but also in the     
 ministry of the work. He wholeheartedly         
 promoted and attended the training of Sunday    
 School, YPWW and the weekly bands. Dad          
 has always been very adamant in his             
 faithfulness in serving the church; and         
       WHEREAS, Richard Sanders, Jr. carried     
 a flaming torch of the gospel from generation   
 to generation. He now rests with the legacy     
 from the Word of God, "Train up a child in      
 the way he should go,..." He trained up all of  
 his children in the way they should go. The     
 fruits of his labor yielded ten saved and       
 sanctified children; one Jurisdictional Bishop  
 (now deceased), four Pastors, three of which    
 serve as Administrative Assistants to the       
 Jurisdictional Bishop and District              
 Superintendents, three Deacons, two             
 Evangelist Missionaries (one now deceased).     
 Dad's legacy lit the way for 31 grandchildren   
 (three now deceased) and more than 50 great-    
 grandchildren, a host of preachers, teachers,   
 singers, musicians, and leaders serving in the  
 church. Dad also left a legacy of strength,     
 endurance, unconditional love and insight,      
 which has been passed on from generation to     
 generation; and                                 
      WHEREAS, in July 2010, Richard             
 Sanders, Jr. was blessed to celebrate his 99th  
 birthday. It was then that he said light-       
 heartedly, "I believe I'll go on to 100 years;  
 they tell me 99 1/2 won't do". In July 2011,    
 God favored him with 100 years of life. On      
 Tuesday, July 17, 2012, just days before his    
 101st birthday, Mr. Sanders moved from his      
 old house into a brand new life; and            
      WHEREAS, Richard Sanders, Jr. leaves       
 to cherish his memory, his children,            
 Administrative Assistant Theodas, Sr. (Mother   
 Gloria D.), Deacon James H. ( Sister Dorothy    
 V.), Deacon Wendell (Sister Shirley T.),        
 Administrative Assistant Courtney, Richard      
 E. (Sister Shirley A.), Evangelist Marilyn      
 Elois, Administrative Assistant Marvin          
 (Evangelist Angela), Assistant Superintendent   
 Darnell (Evangelist Beverly); 1 son-in-law,     
 Pastor Emeritus James T. Jefferson, Sr.         
 (Evangelist Vernetta, deceased), 1 sister,      
 Evangelist Natalie Smith of Chicago, Illinois;  
 his 28 grandchildren, his more than 50 great-   
 grandchildren; a host of nieces, nephews,       
 cousins, the church families of Shiloh,         
 Bethany, Faith Temple, Grace and Gibeon,        
 and a host of Saints and friends.               
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                       
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of            
 the City of St. Louis that we pause to          
 remember the many contributions of Deacon       
 Richard Sanders, Jr. to the citizens of the City
 of St. Louis and we join with his many friends  
 in expressing our sorrow at his passing, and    
we further direct the Clerk of this Board to    
spread a copy of this Resolution across the     
minutes of these proceedings and to prepare a   
memorial copy for presentation to the Sanders   
family, at a time and place deemed appropriate  
by the Sponsor.                                 
Introduced on the 20th day of July, 2012 by:    
Honorable Samuel L. MooreAlderman 4th Ward      
           Resolution No. 93                    
           Theodas Sanders, Jr.                 
       WHEREAS, Theodas Sanders, Jr.            
affectionately known as Ted, was born           
November 28, 1957 in St. Louis, Missouri to     
Theodas, Sr. and Gloria Dean Sanders. He        
was the first born to this union of seven       
children; 5 daughters and 2 sons. He is the     
first to depart from this union. Theodas, Jr.   
accepted our Lord as his Savior and was         
baptized and filled with the Holy Ghost in      
the month of November, the year of 1971, a      
fifth generation member of the church; and      
       WHEREAS, Theodas was educated in         
the St. Louis Public Schools grades K-4th and   
Berkeley Public Schools, grades 5th - 12th.     
He graduated from Berkeley Senior High in       
1976. He continued his education at St. Louis   
Community College at Florissant Valley,         
where he worked towards a degree in Electrical  
Engineering. Ted then attended the Electrical   
Industrial Training Center where upon           
completion he was granted membership into       
the IBEW Local 1 as an Apprentice and later,    
a Journeyman Class A Electrician. He was        
employed for a time with Southwestern Bell      
and in construction as a Journeyman             
Electrician. The next 18 years, Ted was         
employed with the Ford Motor Company,           
first as a Plant Electrician, Line Maintenance  
Electrician, then Robotics Engineer. Ted was    
on track for promotion to Electrical Engineer   
before the plant closing; and                   
      WHEREAS, Theodas was born and             
raised in the Williams Temple Church Of God     
In Christ, under the leadership of the late     
Bishop Columbus Williams until the age of       
fifteen . Upon the leading of the Lord, his     
parents went to worship under the leadership    
of the late Bishop W. Wesley Sanders, his       
uncle. He served faithfully until his father,   
Administrative Assistant Theodas Sanders, Sr.   
began to pastor in St. Louis. There his         
membership remained until his demise.           
Theodas Sanders, Jr. was a member of            
Williams Temple's Sunshine Band. He and his     
2 sisters and brother were named the            
`Sunshine Band Special' by our now, Assistant   
Supervisor, Mother Bertha Daniels. He was       
also a member of the Purity Class and Junior    
Choir. He attended all other bible studies,     
revivals and shut-ins; and                      
       WHEREAS, after his family placed their       
 membership at Shiloh COGIC, Theodas                
 continued serving. At a young age, he often        
 taught Sunday School, as well as YPWW. It          
 was at Shiloh that he began to play the lead       
 guitar. Later, he sang with the choir often        
 leading songs. He was known and sought after       
 for singing the song, "Walk Around Heaven."        
 In the early 1990's, he was blessed in the         
 International Holy Convocation, to sing the        
 sermonic selection preceeding Bishop W.            
 Wesley Sanders' official message. It was at        
 Shiloh, that he accepted his call to the ministry  
 to preach the gospel, a charge he enjoyed; and     
       WHEREAS, he was united in Holy               
 Matrimony to Teri Macon on September 20,           
 1980. To this union was born 2 daughters,          
 Jennifer Theresa and Rebecca Diane. He loved       
 his `girls' (as he called them) very, very much;   
 and                                                
       WHEREAS, Theodas was an ardent               
 worker in the church. He continued to work         
 in ministry, a member of the Joshua and Esther     
 Building Fund group. He worked to help             
 canvas the neighborhoods for Sunday School,        
 washed cars, helped with church renovations.       
 He was also the lead Electrician at Shiloh         
 Church. He also served as an electrician to        
 other sister churches such as, Faith Temple,       
 Carbondale, IL, New Haven COGIC, Wilson            
 City, MO. He aided his father at Bethany           
 COGIC where he helped structure and teach          
 Sunday School. For a period of time, Theodas       
 served the church assisting his father in the      
 ministry. In the timeframe of 2008 - 2009, the     
 Lord directed Theodas to be a support to           
 Gospel Truth Deliverance COGIC, under the          
 leadership of Pastor Jerome Williams, until        
 early 2011. There he supported the ministry        
 and Pastor during the time of the Pastor's         
 infirmity. He supported Pastor and Mother          
 Williams as a son. Theodas Sanders, Jr. was a      
 bible scholar, gifted in the word of the Lord.     
 He was the Superintendent of Sunday Schools        
 for the Columbus Williams District, a member       
 of the EMWI Jurisdiction Sunday School             
 Department. He enjoyed the privilege of            
 serving as a Sunday School Teacher in the Holy     
 Convocation - 2010; and                            
        WHEREAS, Theodas was a caregiver            
 to his grandfather, Deacon Richard Sanders,        
 Jr., to Pastor Jerome Williams, and his younger    
 sister, Kristy. Finally, he cared for his own      
 father with great love, respect and diligence,     
 something he did it with much joy until his        
 own health began to fail; and                      
      WHEREAS, Theodas departed this life           
 on Tuesday, July 17, 2012 at 2:05 AM, at           
 Christian Northeast Hospital. He was               
 surrounded by his entire family. He leaves to      
 cherish his memories, always, his 2 daughters      
 (my girls), Jennifer of St. Louis and Rebecca     
 James (Cory) of Houston, TX, Teri, loving         
 and devoted parents Administrative Assistant      
 Theodas, Sr. and Mother Gloria D. Sanders,        
 Caregiver of Theodas, Jr., 6 siblings, Evangelist 
 Donna Maria ( Elder Barry), Sister Lisa C.,       
 Assistant Pastor Roderick Mark (Evangelist        
 Debbie), Sister Stephanie Lynn, Missionary        
 Kristy Lynette, and Rosalind LeAnn, 5             
 nephews and 3 nieces, Brittany LeAnn,             
 Roderick Mark, II, Barry L., Jr., Patrick Allen   
 (a special nephew), Lauren Nicole, Gloria         
 Maria, Randy LaDell, Theodas Preston              
 (shared same birthdates), 1 grandmother,          
 Mother Illaree Triplett, 1 great-grandmother,     
 Mother Ollie Fay Richardson, 10 uncles, 3         
 aunts, 2 great uncles, 6 great aunts, a host of   
 cousins, friends and the Bethany Church           
 family.                                           
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                         
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of              
 the City of St. Louis that we pause to            
 remember the many contributions of Theodas        
 Sanders, Jr. to the citizens of the City of St.   
 Louis and we join with his many friends in        
 expressing our sorrow at his passing, and we      
 further direct the Clerk of this Board to spread  
 a copy of this Resolution across the minutes      
 of these proceedings and to prepare a memorial    
 copy for presentation to the Sanders family,      
 at a time and place deemed appropriate by         
 the Sponsor.                                      
 Introduced on the 20th day of July, 2012 by:      
 Honorable Samuel L. MooreAlderman 4th Ward        
             Resolution No. 94                     
       Wise-Bell Family & Friends                  
      WHEREAS, the Wise-Bell family are            
 the descendants of Nathaniel Wise and             
 Robizina Bell; and                                
     WHEREAS, from this union, six children        
 were born, four reside in St. Louis, one in       
 New York and one in Arkansas; and                 
      WHEREAS, Nathaniel and Robizina              
 Wise have been blessed in addition to their six   
 children, they are blessed with twenty-nine       
 grandchildren, fifty great grandchildren and      
 twenty-seven great, great grandchildren; and      
      WHEREAS, The 2nd Annual Wise- Bell           
 Family & Friends Reunion will be held in St.      
 Louis July 27th to July 29th; and                 
      WHEREAS, over 75 family members              
 and friends are registered to attend this         
 reunion; and                                      
       WHEREAS, family and friends will            
 travel in for the reunion from all over the nation
 including Missouri, Texas, Delaware,              
 Arkansas, California, Illinois, Tennessee, New    
 York, North Carolina, Georgia, Virginia as well   
as a family member from Japan; and                    
     WHEREAS, the family and friends will             
have a host of activities to partake in, among        
them touring the St. Louis Zoo, City Museum,          
Sky Zone, the Gateway Arch, Normandie                 
Golf Club, the Galleria Mall; and                     
      WHEREAS, on their last day July 29th            
the family will worship together at Friendship        
Missionary Baptist Church.                            
     NOW THEREFORE BE IT                              
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of                  
the City of St. Louis that we pause in our            
deliberations to salute the Wise-Bell family          
and friends. We congratulate them on their            
passion to keep family and friends close even         
though miles separate them except on special          
occasions and wish them a safe journey home.          
We further direct the Clerk of this Board to          
spread a copy of this Resolution across the           
minutes of these proceedings and to prepare a         
commemorative copy to the end that it may             
be presented to our honoree at a time and             
place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.              
Introduced on the 25th day of July, 2012 by:          
Honorable Freeman Bosley, Sr.,Alderman 3rd Ward       
Honorable Lewis E. Reed, President, Board ofAldermen  
            Resolution No. 95                         
        Jermal Leon Seward, Sr.                       
     WHEREAS, we pause in our                         
deliberations to note the passing of Jermal           
Leon Seward, Sr.; and                                 
     WHEREAS, Jermal Leon Seward, Sr.                 
was born April 6, 1943 in Forrest City,               
Arkansas to Mrs. Onezer Stegall Seward and            
Mr. A. Mike Seward. He departed this life on          
Friday, July 27, 2012. His mother and father;         
two sisters and six brothers preceded him in          
death; and                                            
      WHEREAS, as a child he joined New               
Sardis Missionary Baptist Church, in Forrest          
City (New Castle), Arkansas, where his entire         
family were members; and                              
      WHEREAS, Jermal was educated in the             
Forrest City, Arkansas School System. He              
graduated from Lincoln Senior High School.            
He attended Webster University in Saint Louis,        
where he attained a BA in Sociology and a             
minor in Elementary Education in 1975. He             
received his Masters in Educational                   
Counseling from Washington University of              
Saint Louis in 1979. He became a Licensed             
Clinical Social Worker in 1992 with                   
certifications as a Master Addiction Counselor        
and in Forensic Counseling; and                       
     WHEREAS, Jermal's life was dedicated             
to serving the community, as well as his              
country. He served as a member of the United          
 States Army-Private First Class. He has also     
 worked with numerous organizations within        
 the Saint Louis area: St. Martin Childcare       
 Center, Providence Counseling, ECHO              
 Children's Home, Saint Louis Caring              
 Communities, and Better Family Life, Inc; and    
       WHEREAS, Jermal spent 25 years             
 counseling foster care children in their homes   
 in the Saint Louis area. He has touched the      
 lives of hundreds of children and their parents  
 over the years; and                              
     WHEREAS, Jermal leaves to cherish his        
 memory: his wife, Carolyn Seward; son Jermal     
 Seward II (Rachel) of Saint Louis; daughters     
 Daraa' and Makida Seward of Saint Louis.         
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                         
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of             
 the City of St. Louis that we pause to           
 remember the many accomplishments and            
 contributions of Jermal Leon Seward, Sr. to      
 the citizens of the City of St. Louis and we     
 join with his many friends in expressing our     
 sorrow at his passing, and we further direct     
 the Clerk of this Board to spread a copy of      
 this Resolution across the minutes of these      
 proceedings and to prepare a memorial copy       
 for presentation to the Seward family, at a      
 time and place deemed appropriate by the         
 Sponsor.                                         
 Introduced on the 31st day of July, 2012 by:     
 Honorable Frank Williamson,Alderman 26th Ward    
            Resolution No. 96                     
               Mr. Gary Bess                      
       WHEREAS, Community Renewal and             
 Development, Inc. will be hosting its 6th        
 annual Community Development Carnival on         
 August 6, 2012 at DeSoto Park in partnership     
 with 5th Ward Alderwoman Tammika Hubbard         
 and State Representative Penny Hubbard; and      
      WHEREAS, other service providers            
 including; Gateway 180 Homelessness              
 Reversed, CHIPS, Youth and Family Center,        
 COVAM, Office of Neighborhood                    
 Stabilization, Old North St. Louis Restoration   
 Group, Carr Square Tenant Management             
 Corporation, St. Louis Dream Center and          
 RHCDA have dedicated themselves to the           
 support of this event; and                       
       WHEREAS, a number of community             
 stakeholders have established themselves as      
 sponsors of the event including; Crown Food      
 Marts, SM Wilson Company, American Auto          
 Body, Commerce Bank, RHCDA, Old North            
 St. Louis Restoration Group, St. Louis Dream     
 Center, Health Care USA, McCormack Baron         
 Salazar, Salama Markets, St. Louis Housing       
 Authority and PNC Bank; and                      
      WHEREAS,           Mr.     Gary     Bess    
 (Department of Parks, Recreation and          
 Forestry), Ms. Rachel Crowe (St. Louis Crisis 
 Nursery), Mr. Ryan Safi (Crown Food           
 Marts), The Wyman Center, Ms. Heather         
 Loehr (RHCDA), Jimmy Darwish (Crown           
 40) and Mr. Beau Reinberg (Wave Self          
 Storage) are being honored this year because  
 of their continued commitment to the on going 
 revitalization of the 5th Ward.               
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                     
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of          
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our    
 deliberations to recognize Mr. Gary Bess as a 
 friend and invaluable contributor to the 5th  
 Ward in its continued revitalization and      
 restoration and we further direct the Clerk of
 this Board to spread a copy of this Resolution
 across the minutes of these proceedings and   
 to prepare a commemorative copy to the end    
 that it may be presented to our honorees at a 
 time and place deemed appropriate by the      
 Sponsor.                                      
 Introduced on the 3rd day of August, 2012     
 by:                                           
 HonorableTammika Hubbard,Alderwoman 5thWard   
            Resolution No. 97                  
             Ms. Rachel Crowe                  
       WHEREAS, Community Renewal and          
 Development, Inc. will be hosting its 6th     
 annual Community Development Carnival on      
 August 6, 2012 at DeSoto Park in partnership  
 with 5th Ward Alderwoman Tammika Hubbard      
 and State Representative Penny Hubbard; and   
      WHEREAS, other service providers         
 including; Gateway 180 Homelessness           
 Reversed, CHIPS, Youth and Family Center,     
 COVAM, Office of Neighborhood                 
 Stabilization, Old North St. Louis Restoration
 Group, Carr Square Tenant Management          
 Corporation, St. Louis Dream Center and       
 RHCDA have dedicated themselves to the        
 support of this event; and                    
       WHEREAS, a number of community          
 stakeholders have established themselves as   
 sponsors of the event including; Crown Food   
 Marts, SM Wilson Company, American Auto       
 Body, Commerce Bank, RHCDA, Old North         
 St. Louis Restoration Group, St. Louis Dream  
 Center, Health Care USA, McCormack Baron      
 Salazar, Salama Markets, St. Louis Housing    
 Authority and PNC Bank; and                   
      WHEREAS, Mr. Gary Bess                   
 (Department of Parks, Recreation and          
 Forestry), Ms. Rachel Crowe (St. Louis Crisis 
 Nursery), Mr. Ryan Safi (Crown Food           
 Marts), The Wyman Center, Ms. Heather         
 Loehr (RHCDA), Jimmy Darwish (Crown           
 40) and Mr. Beau Reinberg (Wave Self          
 Storage) are being honored this year because  
of their continued commitment to the on going   
revitalization of the 5th Ward.                 
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                       
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of            
the City of St. Louis that we pause in our      
deliberations to recognize Ms. Rachel Crowe     
as a friend and invaluable contributor to the   
5th Ward in its continued revitalization and    
restoration and we further direct the Clerk of  
this Board to spread a copy of this Resolution  
across the minutes of these proceedings and     
to prepare a commemorative copy to the end      
that it may be presented to our honorees at a   
time and place deemed appropriate by the        
Sponsor.                                        
Introduced on the 3rd day of August, 2012       
by:                                             
HonorableTammika Hubbard,Alderwoman 5thWard     
           Resolution No. 98                    
               Mr. Ryan Safi                    
      WHEREAS, Community Renewal and            
Development, Inc. will be hosting its 6th       
annual Community Development Carnival on        
August 6, 2012 at DeSoto Park in partnership    
with 5th Ward Alderwoman Tammika Hubbard        
and State Representative Penny Hubbard; and     
     WHEREAS, other service providers           
including; Gateway 180 Homelessness             
Reversed, CHIPS, Youth and Family Center,       
COVAM, Office of Neighborhood                   
Stabilization, Old North St. Louis Restoration  
Group, Carr Square Tenant Management            
Corporation, St. Louis Dream Center and         
RHCDA have dedicated themselves to the          
support of this event; and                      
      WHEREAS, a number of community            
stakeholders have established themselves as     
sponsors of the event including; Crown Food     
Marts, SM Wilson Company, American Auto         
Body, Commerce Bank, RHCDA, Old North           
St. Louis Restoration Group, St. Louis Dream    
Center, Health Care USA, McCormack Baron        
Salazar, Salama Markets, St. Louis Housing      
Authority and PNC Bank; and                     
      WHEREAS, Mr. Gary Bess                    
(Department of Parks, Recreation and            
Forestry), Ms. Rachel Crowe (St. Louis Crisis   
Nursery), Mr. Ryan Safi (Crown Food             
Marts), The Wyman Center, Ms. Heather           
Loehr (RHCDA), Jimmy Darwish (Crown             
40) and Mr. Beau Reinberg (Wave Self            
Storage) are being honored this year because    
of their continued commitment to the on going   
revitalization of the 5th Ward.                 
     NOW THEREFORE BE IT                        
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of            
the City of St. Louis that we pause in our      
deliberations to recognize Mr. Ryan Safi as a   
 friend and invaluable contributor to the 5th    
 Ward in its continued revitalization and        
 restoration and we further direct the Clerk of  
 this Board to spread a copy of this Resolution  
 across the minutes of these proceedings and     
 to prepare a commemorative copy to the end      
 that it may be presented to our honorees at a   
 time and place deemed appropriate by the        
 Sponsor.

 by:                                             
 HonorableTammika Hubbard,Alderwoman 5thWard     
            Resolution No. 99                    
            The Wyman Center                     
       WHEREAS, Community Renewal and            
 Development, Inc. will be hosting its 6th       
 annual Community Development Carnival on        
 August 6, 2012 at DeSoto Park in partnership    
 with 5th Ward Alderwoman Tammika Hubbard        
 and State Representative Penny Hubbard; and     
      WHEREAS, other service providers           
 including; Gateway 180 Homelessness             
 Reversed, CHIPS, Youth and Family Center,       
 COVAM, Office of Neighborhood                   
 Stabilization, Old North St. Louis Restoration  
 Group, Carr Square Tenant Management            
 Corporation, St. Louis Dream Center and         
 RHCDA have dedicated themselves to the          
 support of this event; and                      
       WHEREAS, a number of community            
 stakeholders have established themselves as     
 sponsors of the event including; Crown Food     
 Marts, SM Wilson Company, American Auto         
 Body, Commerce Bank, RHCDA, Old North           
 St. Louis Restoration Group, St. Louis Dream    
 Center, Health Care USA, McCormack Baron        
 Salazar, Salama Markets, St. Louis Housing      
 Authority and PNC Bank; and                     
       WHEREAS, Mr. Gary Bess                    
 (Department of Parks, Recreation and            
 Forestry), Ms. Rachel Crowe (St. Louis Crisis   
 Nursery), Mr. Ryan Safi (Crown Food             
 Marts), The Wyman Center, Ms. Heather           
 Loehr (RHCDA), Jimmy Darwish (Crown             
 40) and Mr. Beau Reinberg (Wave Self            
 Storage) are being honored this year because    
 of their continued commitment to the on going   
 revitalization of the 5th Ward.                 
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT

 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our      
 deliberations to recognize The Wyman Center     
 as a friend and invaluable contributor to the   
 5th Ward in its continued revitalization and    
 restoration and we further direct the Clerk of

 across the minutes of these proceedings and     
 to prepare a commemorative copy to the end      
 that it may be presented to our honorees at a   
 time and place deemed appropriate by the        
 Sponsor.                                      
 Introduced on the 3rd day of August, 2012     
 by:                                           
 HonorableTammika Hubbard,Alderwoman 5thWard   
            Resolution No. 100                 
            Ms. Heather Loehr                  
       WHEREAS, Community Renewal and          
 Development, Inc. will be hosting its 6th     
 annual Community Development Carnival on      
 August 6, 2012 at DeSoto Park in partnership  
 with 5th Ward Alderwoman Tammika Hubbard      
 and State Representative Penny Hubbard; and   
      WHEREAS, other service providers         
 including; Gateway 180 Homelessness           
 Reversed, CHIPS, Youth and Family Center,     
 COVAM, Office of Neighborhood                 
 Stabilization, Old North St. Louis Restoration
 Group, Carr Square Tenant Management          
 Corporation, St. Louis Dream Center and       
 RHCDA have dedicated themselves to the        
 support of this event; and                    
       WHEREAS, a number of community          
 stakeholders have established themselves as   
 sponsors of the event including; Crown Food   
 Marts, SM Wilson Company, American Auto       
 Body, Commerce Bank, RHCDA, Old North         
 St. Louis Restoration Group, St. Louis Dream  
 Center, Health Care USA, McCormack Baron      
 Salazar, Salama Markets, St. Louis Housing    
 Authority and PNC Bank; and                   
       WHEREAS, Mr. Gary Bess                  
 (Department of Parks, Recreation and          
 Forestry), Ms. Rachel Crowe (St. Louis Crisis 
 Nursery), Mr. Ryan Safi (Crown Food           
 Marts), The Wyman Center, Ms. Heather         
 Loehr (RHCDA), Jimmy Darwish (Crown           
 40) and Mr. Beau Reinberg (Wave Self          
 Storage) are being honored this year because  
 of their continued commitment to the on going 
 revitalization of the 5th Ward.               
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                     
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of          
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our    
 deliberations to recognize Ms. Heather Loehr  
 as a friend and invaluable contributor to the 
 5th Ward in its continued revitalization and  
 restoration and we further direct the Clerk of
 this Board to spread a copy of this Resolution
 across the minutes of these proceedings and   
 to prepare a commemorative copy to the end    
 that it may be presented to our honorees at a 
 time and place deemed appropriate by the      
 Sponsor.                                      
 Introduced on the 3rd day of August, 2012     
 by:                                           
 HonorableTammika Hubbard,Alderwoman 5thWard   
          Resolution No. 101                    
             Jimmy Darwish                      
      WHEREAS, Community Renewal and            
Development, Inc. will be hosting its 6th       
annual Community Development Carnival on        
August 6, 2012 at DeSoto Park in partnership    
with 5th Ward Alderwoman Tammika Hubbard        
and State Representative Penny Hubbard; and     
     WHEREAS, other service providers           
including; Gateway 180 Homelessness             
Reversed, CHIPS, Youth and Family Center,       
COVAM, Office of Neighborhood                   
Stabilization, Old North St. Louis Restoration  
Group, Carr Square Tenant Management            
Corporation, St. Louis Dream Center and         
RHCDA have dedicated themselves to the          
support of this event; and                      
      WHEREAS, a number of community            
stakeholders have established themselves as     
sponsors of the event including; Crown Food     
Marts, SM Wilson Company, American Auto         
Body, Commerce Bank, RHCDA, Old North           
St. Louis Restoration Group, St. Louis Dream    
Center, Health Care USA, McCormack Baron        
Salazar, Salama Markets, St. Louis Housing      
Authority and PNC Bank; and                     
      WHEREAS, Mr. Gary Bess                    
(Department of Parks, Recreation and            
Forestry), Ms. Rachel Crowe (St. Louis Crisis   
Nursery), Mr. Ryan Safi (Crown Food             
Marts), The Wyman Center, Ms. Heather           
Loehr (RHCDA), Jimmy Darwish (Crown             
40) and Mr. Beau Reinberg (Wave Self            
Storage) are being honored this year because    
of their continued commitment to the on going   
revitalization of the 5th Ward.                 
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                       
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of            
the City of St. Louis that we pause in our      
deliberations to recognize Jimmy Darwish as     
a friend and invaluable contributor to the 5th  
Ward in its continued revitalization and        
restoration and we further direct the Clerk of  
this Board to spread a copy of this Resolution  
across the minutes of these proceedings and     
to prepare a commemorative copy to the end      
that it may be presented to our honorees at a   
time and place deemed appropriate by the        
Sponsor.                                        
Introduced on the 3rd day of August, 2012       
by:                                             
HonorableTammika Hubbard,Alderwoman 5thWard     
          Resolution No. 102                    
           Mr. Beau Reinberg                    
      WHEREAS, Community Renewal and            
Development, Inc. will be hosting its 6th       
annual Community Development Carnival on        
August 6, 2012 at DeSoto Park in partnership    
with 5th Ward Alderwoman Tammika Hubbard        
 and State Representative Penny Hubbard; and     
      WHEREAS, other service providers           
 including; Gateway 180 Homelessness             
 Reversed, CHIPS, Youth and Family Center,       
 COVAM, Office of Neighborhood                   
 Stabilization, Old North St. Louis Restoration  
 Group, Carr Square Tenant Management            
 Corporation, St. Louis Dream Center and         
 RHCDA have dedicated themselves to the          
 support of this event; and                      
       WHEREAS, a number of community            
 stakeholders have established themselves as     
 sponsors of the event including; Crown Food     
 Marts, SM Wilson Company, American Auto         
 Body, Commerce Bank, RHCDA, Old North           
 St. Louis Restoration Group, St. Louis Dream    
 Center, Health Care USA, McCormack Baron        
 Salazar, Salama Markets, St. Louis Housing      
 Authority and PNC Bank; and                     
       WHEREAS, Mr. Gary Bess                    
 (Department of Parks, Recreation and            
 Forestry), Ms. Rachel Crowe (St. Louis Crisis   
 Nursery), Mr. Ryan Safi (Crown Food             
 Marts), The Wyman Center, Ms. Heather           
 Loehr (RHCDA), Jimmy Darwish (Crown             
 40) and Mr. Beau Reinberg (Wave Self            
 Storage) are being honored this year because    
 of their continued commitment to the on going   
 revitalization of the 5th Ward.                 
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                       
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of            
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our      
 deliberations to recognize Mr. Beau Reinberg    
 as a friend and invaluable contributor to the   
 5th Ward in its continued revitalization and    
 restoration and we further direct the Clerk of  
 this Board to spread a copy of this Resolution  
 across the minutes of these proceedings and     
 to prepare a commemorative copy to the end      
 that it may be presented to our honorees at a   
 time and place deemed appropriate by the        
 Sponsor.                                        
 Introduced on the 3rd day of August, 2012       
 by:                                             
 HonorableTammika Hubbard,Alderwoman 5thWard     
           Resolution No. 103                    
                Patricia Prete                   
      WHEREAS, we pause in our                   
 deliberations to note the untimely passing of   
 longtime St. Louis City employee, Patricia      
 Prete; and                                      
       WHEREAS, Patricia worked at the           
 Recorder & Registrar's Office for twenty-two    
 years in the former Uniform Commercial Code     
 Department, Marriage License Department         
 and, most recently, in the Land Records         
 Department; and                                 
      WHEREAS, Particia Prete, also known        
 as "Trisha," was born January 7, 1955, the      
 third child of John Vincent Prete and Viola     
 Yates Prete in St. Louis, Missouri. Both        
 parents preceded her in death. Trisha's sunset  
 was Tuesday, July 24, 2012 at St. Mary's        
 Hospital in Richmond Heights, Missouri.         
       WHEREAS, Trisha was the proud and         
 devoted mother of her only son, Marquan,        
 who preceded her in death. She was that same    
 devoted grandmother and great grandmother       
 to his three children, Quanesha, La'Quanda      
 and Marquan and her great grandsons,            
 De'Angelo and Latrell and adopted grandson,     
 Cornelius; and                                  
      WHEREAS, Trisha was educated in the        
 St. Louis Public Schools System; and            
      WHEREAS, she was a faithful member         
 of The New Bethlehem Missionary Baptist         
 Church, serving under leadership of Pastor      
 Hosea' E. Gales; and                            
      WHEREAS, she leaves to cherish her         
 memory:        her grandchildren, great         
 grandchildren, daughter-in-law, Angela Prete;   
 three sisters, Rosemary Windsor (Stanley),      
 Hazel Prete and Annette Prete; and one brother  
 Vincent Prete; all of St. Louis, Missouri; and a
 host of nieces, nephews, cousins and friends;   
 and                                             
      WHEREAS, she was known for her             
 contagious laugh, friendly demeanor, and        
 profound commitment to her family, and will     
 be greatly missed.                              
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                       
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of            
 the City of St. Louis that we pause to          
 remember the many contributions of Patricia     
 Prete to the citizens of the City of St. Louis  
 and we join with her many friends in            
 expressing our sorrow at her passing, and we    
 further direct the Clerk of this Board to spread
 a copy of this Resolution across the minutes    
 of these proceedings and to prepare a memorial  
 copy for presentation to the Prete family, at a 
 time and place deemed appropriate by the        
 Sponsor.                                        
 Introduced on the 3rd day of August, 2012       
 by:                                             
 Honorable Marlene Davis,Alderwoman 19th Ward    
           Resolution No. 104                    
          Officer Julius K. Moore                
            Memorial Highway                     
      WHEREAS, we pause in our                   
 deliberations to note the dedication of a       
 memorial highway sign for the late Officer      
 Julius K. Moore; and                            
      WHEREAS, Julius Keith Moore was            
 born in St. Louis, on November 8, 1985, to      
Pecola and Robert Earl Moore. Julius was          
the second child and the only boy born to his     
parents. Julius received his education from       
Normandy High in 2004, where he played on         
the basketball team. He continued his             
education at Hickey College, receiving a          
certificate for Paralegal and graduated in 2005.  
Julius entered the St. Louis Police Academy       
and graduated in December 2007 and started        
his law enforcement career in the South Patrol    
Area, Third District under the command of         
Captain Jerry Leyshock. Julius was preceded       
in death by his grandmothers, Josephine Jones     
and Prince Alice Moore and his grandfathers,      
Johnnie Williams and Otis Moore; and              
     WHEREAS, Julius confessed the hope           
in Christ and was baptized at four years old      
at Greater Fairfax Missionary Baptist Church,     
under the leadership of Rev. Dr. Haymond          
Fortenberry; and                                  
      WHEREAS, Julius played in the band          
for the choir at the City of Life Church under    
the leadership of Bishop Clifford Fraiser. At     
the time of Julius death, he and his family       
were attending Mount Moriah under the             
leadership of Bishop Milton Green; and            
      WHEREAS, on November 8, 2005,               
Julius was united in matrimony to Alicia Suber    
and from that union three beautiful children      
were born; Javion Alijah, Jayla Alexandra and     
Jayden Keith; and                                 
       WHEREAS, Julius came from a "Strong        
Bonded" family who believed that a "Family        
that Prays Together, Stays Together." There       
was nothing Julius would not do for his family    
or a friend. Julius had a smile that would light  
up a room and that smile was his family           
trademark; and                                    
      WHEREAS, Julius loved his wife, his         
three children, his parents, all of his family    
members and his only sister, who was his          
best friend, Jennifer. Julius and Jennifer were   
thick as thieves and often called twins. They     
shared everything together. Julius lived life     
with a strong passion! He loved to sing, play     
his guitar and being a police officer. Julius     
took the oath of the St. Louis Police             
Department seriously to heart and honored it      
well; and                                         
      WHEREAS, at 6:10 on Thursday,               
October 15, 2009, Julius went home to be          
with the Lord. He leaves to cherish his legacy    
a loving wife, Alicia Moore; one daughter,        
Jayla Alexandra, 4 years old, two sons, Javion    
Alijah, 7 years old and Jayden Keith, 3 years     
old. Also, mother, Pecola Moore; father,          
Robert Earl Moore; sister, Jennifer Smith; five   
brothers-in-law, Christopher Smith, Terrence      
Suber, Travis Suber, Trask Suber and Trevor       
Ingram; sister-in-law, Angela Suber; mother-      
 in-law Joann Ingram; God Mother, Barbara          
 Roseman; three favorite nephews, Jeremiah         
 T. Moore, Jordan S. Smith and Joshua C.           
 Smith and favorite niece, Keira O. Smith; and     
      WHEREAS, he also left to cherish his         
 legacy twelve aunts, Willie Mae Glover, Elaine    
 Moore, Christine Allen, Ann Blair, Marjorie       
 Brown, Alicia Jackson, Marcelle Straughter,       
 Joyce Thames, Lois Jean Curtis, Mae Frances       
 Scrubbs, Alma Sue Buckely, Lorraine Moore;        
 eight uncles, Julius Nunn, Davies Nunn,           
 Theodois Williams, Lindell Moore, Frankie         
 Moore, Eugene Straughter, Willie Thames,          
 Willie Blair; seven great aunts. Fannie Mae       
 Larry, Bernice Watson, Dorothy Prince, Mary       
 Jean Dixon, Minnie Dixon, Georgia Mae             
 Mason and Ruth Dennis; three great uncles,        
 Johnnie Lee Dixon, Ostell Dixon, Lernzell         
 Dixon and a host of nephews, nieces, cousins      
 and friends.                                      
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                         
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of              
 the City of St. Louis that we pause to            
 remember the many contributions of Officer        
 Julius K. Moore to the citizens of the City of    
 St. Louis and we join with his many friends in    
 expressing our thanks, and we further direct      
 the Clerk of this Board to spread a copy of       
 this Resolution across the minutes of these       
 proceedings and to prepare a copy for             
 presentation to the Moore family, at a time       
 and place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.      
 Introduced on the 10th day of August, 2012        
 by:                                               
 HonorableAntonio D. French,Alderman 21st Ward     
           Resolution No. 105                      
     The Honorable Gregory J. Carter               
       WHEREAS, Gregory J. Carter was born         
 on June 6, 1958 in St. Louis, Missouri to the     
 late Senator Paula J. Carter and Willie Carter.   
 He was the second of four children; and           
      WHEREAS, Greg Carter grew up and             
 lived his adult life in the 27th Ward of the      
 City of St. Louis. Greg graduated from the St.    
 Louis public school system and furthered his      
 education at Southeast Missouri State and         
 Columbia College with a Bachelor's Degree in      
 Business and Marketing; and                       
      WHEREAS, he married Barbara                  
 Brantley, his high school sweetheart, on          
 October 9, 1982, and had two children,            
 Gregory James Carter, II and Jennifer Noel        
 Carter; and                                       
       WHEREAS, Gregory J. Carter was              
 elected Alderman of the 27th Ward in 1993         
 and served his community with great honor,        
 love and pride until his passing August 1, 2012;  
 and                                               
      WHEREAS, in addition to his elected       
 position as Alderman of the 27th Ward,         
 Alderman Carter was an employee of the         
 United Parcel Service since 1984 and was a     
 member of H. McGhee Lodge #3, Prince Hall      
 Free and Accepted Masons of Missouri, 100      
 Black Men, the NAACP, and various              
 community driven organizations; and            
       WHEREAS, Alderman Carter also            
 chaired the Paula J. Carter Wine and Roses     
 Reception which raises funds to assist         
 constituents during tragic and trying times and
 to support various programs and activities in  
 the community. He served as Vice Chair of St.  
 Louis African American Aldermanic Caucus       
 Foundation. He was also the Vice Chair of the  
 African American Aldermanic Caucus where       
 he served as Chair for many years; and         
      WHEREAS, Greg Carter was a tireless       
 leader and worker for his community, his       
 family and for the greater good of the City of 
 St. Louis. The City of St. Louis has lost a    
 tremendous community leader and public         
 servant and he will be greatly missed for years
 to come; and                                   
      WHEREAS, as testament to his service,     
 Alderman Carter received numerous awards:      
 The Trailblazer Award from the 100 Black       
 Men, Chairman Awards from the Human            
 Development Corporation, Lifetime              
 Achievement Award from the St. Louis           
 Teachers and School Related Personnel Union,   
 Local 420, the Walbridge Community             
 Education Lifetime Achievement Award, the      
 Achievement Award of the Missouri Waste        
 Coalition, Community Services Award, from      
 the Legal Services of Eastern Missouri and     
 several awards from different block units and  
 churches in his community; and                 
       WHEREAS, Alderman Carter knew the        
 true power of legacy, as he not only followed  
 in the footsteps of service and community      
 left by his mother, Paula J. Carter, but also  
 engaged the younger generation, including      
 those in his family, to be ready to carry the  
 torch forward thus leaving his own legacy for  
 others to follow.                              
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                      
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of           
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our     
 deliberations to recognize and praise the      
 tremendous contributions the Honorable         
 Gregory J. Carter made to our community,       
 this board, and the entire city and we further 
 direct the Clerk of this Board to spread a copy
 of this Resolution across the minutes of these 
 proceedings and to prepare a commemorative     
 copy to the end that it may be presented to    
 our honoree at a time and place deemed         
 appropriate by the Sponsor.                    
Introduced on the 10th day of August, 2012            
by:                                                   
HonorableTerry Kennedy,Alderman 18th Ward             
Honorable Lewis E. Reed, President, Board ofAldermen  
Honorable Charles QuincyTroupe,Alderman 1stWard       
Honorable Dionne Flowers,Alderwoman 2nd Ward
