Honorable Samuel L. Moore,Alderman 4th Ward           
HonorableTammika Hubbard,Alderwoman 5thWard           
Honorable Kacie StarrTriplett,Alderwoman 6thWard      
Honorable Phyllis Young,Alderwoman 7th Ward           
Honorable Stephen Conway,Alderman 8th Ward            
Honorable Kenneth Ortmann,Alderman 9thWard            
Honorable Joseph Vollmer,Alderman 10th Ward           
Honorable ThomasAlbert Villa,Alderman 11th Ward       
Honorable LarryArnowitz,Alderman 12th Ward            
HonorableAlfred Wessels, Jr.,Alderman 13th Ward       
Honorable Carol Howard,Alderwoman 14th Ward           
Honorable Jennifer Florida,Alderwoman 15th Ward       
Honorable Donna Baringer,Alderwoman 16th Ward         
Honorable Joseph Roddy,Alderman 17th Ward             
Honorable Marlene E. Davis,Alderwoman 19th Ward       
Honorable Craig Schmid,Alderman 20th Ward             
HonorableAntonio D. French,Alderman 21st Ward         
Honorable Jeffrey L. Boyd,Alderman 22nd Ward          
Honorable Joe Vaccaro,Alderman 23rd Ward              
Honorable Scott Ogilvie,Alderman 24th Ward            
Honorable Shane Cohn,Alderman 25th Ward               
Honorable Frank Williamson,Alderman 26th Ward         
Honorable Lyda Krewson,Alderwoman 28th Ward           
           Resolution No. 106                         
          Soldan Class of 1964                        
            Alumni Members                            
     WHEREAS, the distinguished Soldan                
Class of 1964 Alumni Members will host their          
48th celebration of happiness as they reunite         
with friends and loved ones who attended              
Soldan High School; and                               
     WHEREAS, the Soldan celebration will             
be held in St. Louis at the Airport Marriott          
Hotel on August 10 - 11, 2012; and                    
     WHEREAS, over 50 family members                  
and friends are registered to attend this             
reunion; and                                          
      WHEREAS, since 1909, the learning               
environment at Soldan has helped produce              
several notable alumni; including politicians,        
authors, academic benchmarks, and world-              
class athletes; and                                   
      WHEREAS, alumni and friends will                
travel in for the reunion from all over the nation    
including Missouri, Texas, Arkansas,                  
California, Illinois, Tennessee, New York,            
North Carolina, Georgia and Virginia; and             
      WHEREAS, on evening of August 11th,             
the Soldan Class of 1964 Alumni Members               
will be reuniting and reminiscing with their          
classmates once again.                                
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                         
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of              
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our        
 deliberations to salute the Soldan Class of       
 1964 Alumni Members and we congratulate           
 them for their passion to remain close even       
 though miles apart and wish them a safe return    
 home. We further direct the Clerk of this         
 Board to spread a copy of this Resolution         
 across the minutes of these proceedings and       
 to prepare a commemorative copy to the end        
 that it may be presented to our honoree at a      
 time and place deemed appropriate by the          
 Sponsor.                                          
 Introduced on the 10th day of August, 2012        
 by:                                               
 Honorable Dionne Flowers,Alderwoman 2nd Ward      
           Resolution No. 107                      
   The Ninth Anniversary Weekend of                
    the Charles Sumner High School                 
          Classes of 1946 - 1951                   
       WHEREAS, Charles Sumner High                
 School is planning its Ninth Class Reunion        
 for the Classes of 1946 through 1951, one of      
 the largest class reunions in the City of Saint   
 Louis; and                                        
       WHEREAS, Sumner High School sits            
 in the Ville at Pendleton and Cottage Avenues     
 which at one period in Saint Louis was the        
 center of black educational institutions and      
 recreational facilities, which has graduated      
 thousands of young students, many of whom         
 whose educational pursuit has climaxed with       
 distinguished careers and professions in all      
 phases of employment opportunities; and           
       WHEREAS, this year, 2012 represents         
 the reunion of the Sumner High School classes     
 of 1946 through 1951 and it is most proper        
 and appropriate to congratulate all former        
 graduates for their accomplishments and           
 progress through the year; and                    
      WHEREAS, the citizens of the Fourth          
 Ward, over the years and presently, revere the    
 proud heritage of Sumner High School.             
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                          
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of              
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our        
 deliberations to recognize and honor the Ninth    
 Anniversary Weekend of the Charles Sumner         
 High School Classes of 1946 - 1951 and we         
 further direct the Clerk of this Board to spread  
 a copy of this Resolution across the minutes      
 of these proceedings and to prepare a             
 commemorative copy to the end that it may         
 be presented to our honorees at a time and        
 place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.          
 Introduced on the 17th day of August, 2012        
 by:                                               
 Honorable Samuel L. Moore,Alderman 4th Ward     
           Resolution No. 108                    
                JOEL P.E. KING                   
       WHEREAS, Joel P.E. King is founder        
 and proprietor of JPEK CreativeWorks, LLC       
 which is a fine arts company that has worked    
 diligently to support the community through     
 arts, entertainment and education. Through      
 creative workshops, original stage plays,       
 producing and promoting independent artists,    
 JPEK has built a structure that is respected    
 and sought for greater exposure; and            
       WHEREAS, Joel P.E. King is a native       
 East St. Louisan who takes each opportunity     
 to create truly divine. He graduated from       
 Southern Illinois University with a B.A. in     
 Studio Arts and a minor in Music and Theater.   
 Joel is a prominent performer in the            
 Metropolitan area working on international      
 acclaim; and                                    
      WHEREAS, Joel's theater credits that       
 precede him are: A Raisin in the Sun, Colored   
 Museum, Immigrant Project, In the Blood,        
 Dutchman, and Complacency of Silence in         
 which he received a Kevin Kline nomination      
 for Outstanding Supporting Actor In A Play;     
 and                                             
      WHEREAS, Joel's musical credits            
 include: Big River, Damn Yankees Bubblin        
 Brown Sugar, Ain't Misbehavin, and Porgy        
 and Bess as well as a world premiere show,      
 Ruth and Joshua's Boots; and                    
      WHEREAS, he toured with gospel show        
 A House Divided where he performed in front     
 of BET-Comic Award Winner Tyler Perry who       
 complimented him on "a job well done;" and      
       WHEREAS, JPEK's mission is to             
 produce quality in performance on and off       
 stage. They endeavor to be community            
 supporters by finding the need and meeting it   
 through the Arts. Joel thanks the Creator for   
 the gift to simply create; and                  
      WHEREAS, on August 23-26th, JPEK           
 CreativeWorks presents thrilling new drama,     
 Stand Your Ground at the Grandel Theater,       
 3610 Grandel Square, St. Louis to               
 commemorate those we have lost to hate          
 crimes; and                                     
       WHEREAS, on August 23rd, the              
 Grandel Theater begins the run of the show      
 with exclusive Opening Night. Highlights of     
 A Red Carpet Evening include celebrity guests   
 appearances and silent auction of artwork       
 produced by Keidra Pelloquin to                 
 commemorate those we have lost from hate        
 crimes. A portion of proceeds will be donated   
 to a selected charitable organization.          
      NOW       THEREFORE            BE        IT
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of                 
the City of St. Louis that we pause to               
recognize the many achievements and success          
of Joel P.E. King and we direct the Clerk of         
this Board to spread a copy of this Resolution       
across the minutes of these proceedings and          
to prepare a commemorative copy for                  
presentation to the honoree, at a time and place     
deemed appropriate by the Sponsor                    
Introduced on the 17th day of August, 2012           
by:                                                  
Honorable Marlene Davis,Alderwoman 19th Ward         
           Resolution No. 109                        
           Dr. Matthew German                        
     WHEREAS, we pause to recognize Dr.              
Matthew German for his many years of                 
service to the community; and                        
     WHEREAS, for more than a decade, Dr.            
Matthew German and his circle of friends have        
come together to raise money for human               
service organizations that respond to the            
unmet medical needs of marginalized groups           
of people; and                                       
      WHEREAS, this fundraising has                  
generated hundreds of thousands of dollars to        
support local HIV/AIDS service organizations         
that promote quality of life for our neighbors;      
and                                                  
     WHEREAS, community parties known                
as "Dr. Matt's Parties With A Purpose" have          
gained in popularity and momentum as the             
major fundraising vehicle; and                       
      WHEREAS, this year, support is                 
pledged to Doctors Without Borders in                
support of their missions to address the             
escalating health crisis in Haiti, the South Sudan,  
Zimbabwe and among Syrian refugees in                
Lebanon; and                                         
     WHEREAS, Matthew German and                     
friends will come together, Sunday, August           
19, 2012 at a Community Party to generate            
funds for Doctors Without Borders.                   
     NOW THEREFORE BE IT                             
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of                 
the City of Saint Louis that we pause in our         
deliberations to recognize Dr. Matthew               
German for his philanthropy and goodwill to          
the St. Louis community and world                    
communities and we further direct the Clerk          
of this Board to spread a copy of this               
Resolution across the minutes of these               
proceedings and to prepare a commemorative           
copy to the end that it may be presented to          
our honoree at a time and place deemed               
appropriate by the Sponsor.                          
Introduced on the 17th day of August, 2012           
by:                                                  
 Honorable Lyda Krewson,Alderwoman 28th Ward       
           Resolution No. 110                      
                 Roha USA                          
       WHEREAS, we have been apprised              
 Roha USA has just finished undergoing a $5        
 million expansion in the City of St. Louis; and   
       WHEREAS, this expansion has                 
 increased their capacities in almost every        
 aspect. Roha has introduced new technology        
 to increase efficiency, reduce employee efforts   
 through ergonomics, and to give back to the       
 community; and                                    
      WHEREAS, during the re-design Roha           
 repurposed its warehouse capacity into            
 manufacturing square footage, increasing the      
 production area by over 400%. Also, Roha          
 acquired a second location, to increase           
 warehouse capacity by 200% from before;           
 and                                               
       WHEREAS, the expansion allows Roha          
 to further increase production. This increase     
 in production will in turn lead to more jobs.     
 They are expecting about 5 new employees a        
 year for the next 5 years. The expansion and      
 redesign of the facilities also encompasses       
 employee areas. The areas outside of the          
 manufacturing area affected were the break        
 room, the locker room and the warehouse           
 office; and                                       
       WHEREAS, Roha's non business motto          
 is "To care and safeguard the environment"        
 and has been proven time and time again.          
 Recently. they have completed a 25 MW solar       
 plant in India; and                               
       WHEREAS, in addition to conserving          
 energy Roha has started a university, donates     
 to hospitals, and believes education will lead    
 the future. The JJT University is to provide      
 knowledge and educate students in science,        
 technology and in other areas so that instead     
 of job-seekers they become providers/creators     
 of jobs.                                          
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                          
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of              
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our        
 deliberations to recognize Roha USA and we        
 further direct the Clerk of this Board to spread  
 a commemorative copy to the end that it may       
 be presented to our honoree at a time and         
 place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.          
 Introduced on the 24th day of August, 2012        
 by:                                               
 Honorable Joseph Roddy,Alderman 17th Ward         
            Resolution No. 111                     
  Mrs. Eleanor Helen (Marval) Rimkus               
      WHEREAS, Eleanor Helen Rimkus was            
 born on August 29, 1922 and has attained the      
 age of 90 years on this date of August 29th,    
 2012; and                                       
      WHEREAS, Eleanor Helen Rimkus was          
 the second oldest of four children born to      
 Rudolph and Eleanor Marval of St. Louis,        
 Missouri; and                                   
      WHEREAS, Eleanor Helen Rimkus              
 received her formal education at Our Lady of    
 Sorrows Elementary School, Gardenville          
 Ninth Grade Center and graduated with a         
 diploma from Hadley Technical High School;      
 and                                             
       WHEREAS, Eleanor Helen Rimkus             
 married Charles Joseph Rimkus and as a result   
 of this Catholic wedded union became the        
 proud mother of Barbara, Charles II, Roger,     
 Dennis and Teresa whom they raised to observe   
 a high standard of values and citizenship with  
 the family growing to seven grandchildren and   
 six great-grandchildren, plus two beloved dogs  
 Sadie and Zena; and                             
      WHEREAS, Eleanor Helen Rimkus has          
 been an active member of Our Lady of Sorrows    
 Catholic Church serving as a member of many     
 organizations including the Women's Guild,      
 Over 50 Club, Quilting Group and the Red        
 Hat Ladies; and                                 
      WHEREAS, Eleanor Helen Rimkus has          
 spent many hours perfecting her special talent  
 of sewing and quilting to benefit herself, her  
 family and community; and                       
      WHEREAS, Eleanor Helen Rimkus has          
 been a life-long resident of South St. Louis    
 City setting high standards of neighborhood     
 and civic pride with devotion to family and     
 neighbors; and                                  
        WHEREAS, the City of St. Louis           
 wishes to honor, thank and support our senior   
 life-long member who has been an outstanding    
 citizen and role model.                         
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                       
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of            
 the City of St. Louis, that we pause in our     
 deliberations to recognize and congratulate     
 Eleanor Helen Rimkus on her 90th birthday       
 for her tireless contributions to her family,   
 church, community and the City of St. Louis,    
 Missouri and by adoption of this resolution     
 to join in the festivities honoring her and we  
 further direct the Clerk of this Board to spread
 a copy of this resolution across the minutes    
 of these proceedings and to prepare a           
 commemorative copy to the end that it may       
 be presented to the honoree at a time and place 
 deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.              
 Introduced on the 24th day of August, 2012      
 by:                                             
 Honorable Donna Baringer,Alderwoman 16th Ward   
           Resolution No. 112                       
                Bradd Young                         
      WHEREAS, Bradd Young is a R&B/                
Hip-Hop inspired music powerhouse who               
defies age and defines class with his lush vocals,  
hypnotic beats and melodic keys, all while          
continuing to cultivate his craft; and              
      WHEREAS, with humble beginnings in            
St. Louis, Bradd didn't settle for less when it     
came to pursuing a career in music. He started      
playing the drums and piano as a child while        
attending Emerson Elementary School. In high        
school, he was a leader in choir and eventually     
became the co-founder of the community choir        
and majored in classical piano. After graduating    
from Berkeley High School in 1997, Bradd            
picked up the guitar; and                           
      WHEREAS, by age 16, Bradd was                 
putting together tracks for Epic Records &          
Heineken's Red Star Sounds soundtrack. After        
high school Bradd moved to Atlanta to further       
pursue his passion of being successful in the       
music business and even landed the                  
opportunity to work with the late Lisa              
"Lefteye" Lopez from the multi-platinum             
female group TLC and a host of other artists;       
and                                                 
      WHEREAS, standing as one of the few           
solo artists in the industry who still fuses        
precise      choreography         with    live      
instrumentation, Bradd's on-stage                   
performance is vivacious, yet versatile as he       
flexes his range and remaining true to his          
artistry. With his magnetic yet mystical            
personality, Bradd has managed to keep              
himself grounded by supporting other artists        
as they try to get to the next level; and           
      WHEREAS, never staying stagnant,              
Bradd has also shared his writing and               
producing skills with industry giants such as:      
Akon, Teddy Riley, Bone Thugs & Harmony,            
Kelly Rowland, Maino, Makeba Riddick,               
Jibbs, Tyra B, Yolanda Adams, Yo Gotti and          
The St. Lunatics; and WHEREAS, along                
with his production partner Prettyboy, Bradd        
continues to manage, produce and develop a          
team of extreme talent on their RockHouse           
Music imprint. RockHouse is a company               
that promotes artist creativity and ownership.      
Their company tagline is "We follow history,        
never trends"; and                                  
     WHEREAS, Bradd's vision of                     
RockHouse is more than a dream, it's now a          
force to be reckoned with. With his latest          
single "Grown Man" racing up the charts in          
growing markets, there is no doubt that Bradd       
Young is destined for greatness.                    
   NOW THEREFORE BE IT                              
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of                
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our          
 deliberations to recognize Bradd Young for          
 his many achievements and accomplishments           
 and we further direct the Clerk of this Board       
 to spread a copy of this Resolution across the      
 minutes of these proceedings and to prepare a       
 commemorative copy to the end that it may           
 be presented to our honoree at a time and           
 place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.            
 Introduced on the 24th day of August, 2012          
 by:                                                 
 Honorable Jeffrey L. Boyd,Alderman 22nd Ward        
            Resolution No. 113                       
     13th Annual Festival of Nations                 
      WHEREAS, we have been apprised that            
 the International Institute's 13th annual           
 Festival of Nations will take place August 25-      
 26 in Tower Grove Park; and                         
      WHEREAS, the Festival of Nations is a          
 multiethnic celebration that highlights and         
 celebrates multiculturalism in the St. Louis        
 community and beyond; and                           
       WHEREAS, today's Festival of Nations          
 has its origins in the International May            
 Festival, first held in St. Louis in 1920.          
 Organized by the International Institute of         
 St. Louis, the May Festival was one of the          
 earliest multicultural celebrations in our nation;  
 and                                                 
       WHEREAS, last year, more than                 
 140,000 visitors attended Festival of Nations.      
 They dined and shopped at booths                    
 representing 51 ethnicities and delighted in        
 arts and performances representing 62               
 ethnicities. In all, 81 ethnicities were            
 represented at the festival which represents        
 the traditions of St. Louis' long-timers and        
 newcomers alike; and                                
       WHEREAS, this year's Festival of              
 Nations will feature three stages of non-stop       
 dynamic music and dance performances by             
 traditional ethnic artists, world music favorites   
 and the finest traditional acoustic music and       
 song. From Spanish flamenco to a Vietnamese         
 lion dance, from thundering drums to Irish          
 harp, there is something for every taste! Back      
 by popular demand, COBU, Japanese taiko,            
 direct form New York City; and                      
       WHEREAS, there will be 50 food booths         
 featuring Ethiopian injera with doro wat,           
 Filipino kebabs, and other mouth-watering           
 ethnic treats.                                      
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                            
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of                
 the City of St. Louis, that we pause in our         
 deliberations to recognize the 13th Annual          
 Festival of Nations and we thank the                
 International Institute for their contributions     
 to the citizens of the St. Louis community          
 and we direct the Clerk of this Board to            
 prepare a commemorative copy of this                
 Resolution to the end that it may be presented      
 to our honorees at a time and place deemed          
 appropriate by the Sponsor.                         
 Introduced on the 24th day of August, 2012          
 by:                                                 
 Honorable Jennifer Florida,Alderwoman 15th Ward     
 Honorable Lewis E. Reed, President, Board ofAldermen
 Honorable Stephen Conway,Alderman 8th Ward          
 Honorable Craig N. Schmid,Alderman 20th Ward        
            Resolution No. 114                       
  CELEBRATION OF THE 85th BIRTHDAY                   
    ANNIVERSARY OF LORRAINE URA                      
      WHEREAS, LORRAINE DELORES                      
 URA was born on Monday, August 22, 1927             
 (the 234th day of that year) as the second          
 child (brother: Harold) of Harold and Rose          
 Koessler; and                                       
        WHEREAS, lesser known historical             
 events of August 22, include: Ann Franklin          
 becomes the first female U.S. newspaper editor      
 (1762); King George III of England declares         
 the American colonies are in open rebellion         
 (1775); the beginning of the Haitian Slave          
 Revolution in Saint-Domingue (1791); the U.S.       
 annexes New Mexico (1846); First Geneva             
 Convention (humane treatment of victims of          
 war) signed by 12 nations ( 1864); International    
 Red Cross founded (1864); William J. Kendall        
 swims through Niagra Rapids wearing a cork          
 life jacket (1886); Cadillac Motor Company          
 founded (1901); President Theodore                  
 Roosevelt is first U.S. President to ride in an     
 automobile (1902); first Victor Victrola            
 manufactured (1906); theft of Mona Lisa             
 painting discovered (1911); World War I: in         
 Belgium the British and German troops clash         
 for the first time in the war (1914); President     
 Eisenhower and Vice President Nixon                 
 renominated by Republican convention in San         
 Francisco (1956); attempt to assassinate            
 French President Charles de Gaulle fails            
 (1962); Hurricane Camille strikes U.S. Gulf         
 Coast killing 255 (1969); Beatles conduct last      
 photo session at John Lennon's & Yoko Ono's         
 house.                                              
      WHEREAS, LORRAINE URA was                      
 married to Allen J. Ura (deceased) for more         
 than 25 years and is the proud mother of three      
 children: Carol Trauth, Don Vehlewald and           
 Gary Vehlewald; and stepmother to six               
 children: Joyce, Bob, Harry, Mike, Steve,and        
 Linda; and                                          
      WHEREAS, LORRAINE URA has                      
 more than 25 grandchildren, 15 great                
 grandchildren, 2 great, great grandchildren         
 (and counting), and a special dog by the name       
 of Paris; and                                       
     WHEREAS, LORRAINE URA,                       
worked full-time at her father's business,        
Koessler Motor Company at S. Broadway             
and Keokuk, keeping the financial books for       
many years and cooking two meals each day         
for the workers of the business; she also         
worked at Anheuser Busch Brewery as a             
secretary and accountant and in the the           
Missouri Twenty-Second Judicial Circuit           
Court Clerk's Office; and                         
     WHEREAS, LORRAINE URA loves                  
St. Louis and has been the Democratic             
Committeewoman of the 10th ward (now 20th         
ward) since August 1996; she is an active         
member of St. Marcus United Church of Christ      
at Russell Blvd. and McNair Ave.; and has         
lived in her home in the Marine Villa             
Neighborhood for more than 50 years; and          
     WHEREAS, according to our reckoning          
this August 22, 2012, is an extra special         
birthday anniversary celebration for              
LORRAINE URA, because she has attained            
the 85 year mark.                                 
     NOW THEREFORE BE IT                          
RESOLVED BY THE BOARD OF                          
ALDERMEN OF THE CITY OF ST.                       
LOUIS that we pause in our deliberations to       
recognize this 85th birthday anniversary and      
to wish Lorraine Ura a HAPPY 85th                 
BIRTHDAY! We wish her many more healthy           
years and birthdays. We further direct the        
Clerk of the Board of Aldermen to spread a        
copy of this Resolution across the Minutes        
of our proceedings and to prepare a               
commemorative copy to the end that it may         
be presented at a time and                        
place deemed appropriate by the sponsor.          
Introduced on the 24th day of August 2012         
by                                                
Honorable Craig N. Schmid,Alderman 20th Ward      
          Resolution No. 115                      
       The 100th Anniversary of                   
           Lashly & Baer, P.C.                    
      WHEREAS, Lashly & Baer, P.C., a law         
firm, was founded in downtown St. Louis by        
Jacob M. Lashly, who was considered one of        
Missouri's most outstanding trial lawyers and     
served as President of the American Bar           
Association and The Missouri Bar; and             
     WHEREAS, 2012 marks the 100th                
anniversary of the firm's founding; and           
      WHEREAS, the firm has provided              
counsel to clients engaged in some of the most    
significant projects in St. Louis including       
MetroLink, the St. Louis Convention Center        
Headquarters Hotel, the successful effort to      
transfer jurisdiction of the crumbling, historic  
McKinley Bridge for rehabilitation, and the       
 current renovation of Central Library; and       
       WHEREAS, the firm has made                 
 significant contributions to projects involving  
 the economic development of downtown St.         
 Louis, including the acquisition and             
 rehabilitation of the area between Memorial      
 Plaza and Union Station by the Land Clearance    
 for Redevelopment Authority in 1954 and the      
 creation of The Partnership for Downtown         
 St. Louis in 1995 which now actively             
 represents and advocates the interests of        
 residents, business and property owners in       
 downtown St. Louis; and                          
      WHEREAS, Lashly & Baer worked on            
 behalf of the Board of Education for the City    
 of St. Louis to bring about equal education      
 opportunities for city students through the      
 landmark desegregation case that began in        
 1972; and                                        
       WHEREAS, the firm helped secure            
 hundreds of millions of dollars in funding for   
 new and renovated schools in the city, which     
 has helped improve education for thousands       
 of students; and                                 
       WHEREAS, the leadership of the firm        
 showed a strong commitment to downtown           
 by renovating a century-old former bank          
 building into modern legal offices to house its  
 staff of approximately 100 people; and           
      WHEREAS, attorneys and staff of             
 Lashly & Baer have committed to carry out        
 "100 Acts of Civic Kindness" in 2012 to          
 improve the quality of life in our city through  
 volunteer activities.                            
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                         
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of             
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our       
 deliberations to recognize and honor the many    
 contributions made to the City of St. Louis      
 by Lashly & Baer over the past 100 years and     
 we direct the Clerk of this Board to spread a    
 copy of this Resolution across the minutes of    
 these proceedings and to further prepare a       
 commemorative copy to the end that it may        
 be presented to our honorees at a time and       
 place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.         
 Introduced on the 20th day of August, 2012       
 by:                                              
 Honorable Phyllis Young,Alderwoman 7th Ward      
           Resolution No. 116                     
             The St. Louis Bop                    
      WHEREAS, the St. Louis Bop, a partner       
 dance evolved from the Lindy Hop and similar     
 vernacular dances, and                           
      WHEREAS, the St. Louis Bop was              
 conceived in St. Louis, since the late 1950's,   
 and has continued in local popularity; and       
        WHEREAS, the St. Louis Bop is                
 beneficial to youth, in that youth learn the        
 fundamentals and cooperation of teamwork            
 for life experiences, they grasp dance rhythmic     
 movement patterns readily, in that physical,        
 emotional, social and cognitive growth are          
 encouraged, in that dance provides a total form     
 of exercise to help fight and prevent obesity,      
 assists in the acceptance of social graces and      
 etiquette, and in the development of self-          
 esteem and creativity; and                          
       WHEREAS, the St. Louis Bop is                 
 beneficial to adults, in that it retards the aging  
 process, supports the cardiovascular system         
 and lung capacity while promoting weight            
 loss, aids in the treatment of osteoporosis,        
 provides exercise to the body for increased         
 circulation, aids lipid control, provides mental    
 exercise, promotes balance to aid in                
 strengthening stabilizer muscles, promotes          
 creativity, and elevates mood by raising            
 endorphin levels; and                               
      WHEREAS, the St. Louis Bop has                 
 proven to be recreational and entertaining, has     
 evident longevity, has no cultural barriers,        
 promotes a healthy lifestyle, self-confidence       
 and self-discipline by improving a sense of         
 well-being; and                                     
       WHEREAS, the St. Louis Bop continues          
 to be relevant to people of all ages, continues     
 to grow and gain widespread popularity              
 reaching beyond the local region and spreading      
 onto the national stage preserving and              
 promoting the artistic experience of social         
 dancing to citizens of all ages and cultures.       
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                           
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of                
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our          
 deliberations to recognize the St. Louis Bop        
 in that it promotes healthy and fulfilling          
 experiences and benefits to the City of St.         
 Louis and we further direct the Clerk of this       
 Board to spread a copy of this Resolution           
 across the minutes of these proceedings and         
 to prepare a commemorative copy to the end          
 that it may be presented to our honoree at a        
 time and place deemed appropriate by the            
 Sponsor.                                            
 Introduced on the 24th day of August, 2012          
 by:                                                 
 Honorable Lewis E. Reed, President, Board ofAldermen
            Resolution No. 117                       
           Sgt. Richmond Lingard                     
      WHEREAS, Sgt. Richmond Lingard                 
 began his law enforcement career when he            
 entered the Police Academy on April 17, 1989        
 and became a commissioned officer in August         
 of 1989; and                                        
     WHEREAS, Sgt. Richmond Lingard, as               
a police officer, strived everyday to protect         
and preserve the safety of the citizens who           
reside or visit the City of St. Louis: and            
      WHEREAS, Sgt. Lingard has had many              
different assignments in his 23 years as an           
officer; and                                          
     WHEREAS, he obtained the rank of                 
sergeant April 26, 2008; and                          
     WHEREAS, Sgt. Lingard's most recent              
assignment has been in the 2nd District; and          
      WHEREAS, on March 23rd, while at                
home, his peace and tranquility was shattered         
when two individuals breaking into his home           
shot and wounded Sgt. Richmond; and                   
      WHEREAS, always the professional                
Sgt. Lingard secured his safety and even though       
wounded had the presence of mind to give a            
detailed description of the intruders to the          
911 dispatcher; and                                   
     WHEREAS,            Sgt.    Lingard's            
professionalism resulted in fellow officers           
securing the capture of the two suspects.             
     NOW THEREFORE BE IT                              
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of                  
the City of St. Louis that we pause in our            
deliberations to recognize and praise the             
tremendous contributions Sgt. Richmond                
Lingard has made to our community, and wish           
him continued progress in his recovery. We            
further direct the Clerk of this Board to spread      
a copy of this Resolution across the minutes          
of these proceedings and to prepare a                 
commemorative copy to the end that it may             
be presented to our honoree at a time and             
place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.              
Introduced on the 24th day of August, 2012            
by:                                                   
Honorable Lewis E. Reed, President, Board ofAldermen  
           Resolution No. 118                         
                Ronald J. Aug                         
      WHEREAS, we have been apprised that             
after many years of dedicated service to the          
citizens of the City of St. Louis Ronald J. Aug       
will retire on August 31, 2012; and                   
      WHEREAS, Ron began employment                   
with the City of St. Louis in 1976 at St. Louis       
Area Agency on Aging (SLAAA); and                     
       WHEREAS, he was promoted and                   
accepted a position at Lambert International          
Airport in December 1979 and has remained             
at the airport until his retirement. His current      
title is Accountant II; and                           
     WHEREAS, Ron attended St. John the               
Baptist Elementary and High School and                
graduated in 1971. He attended University of          
 MO (UMSL) and graduated in 1975; and              
      WHEREAS, he attends St. John the             
 Baptist Church, where he has been a member        
 more than 50 years. His favorite charity is St.   
 Vincent DePaul.                                   
      WHEREAS, Ron is single. His family           
 members include his sister, Mary Luedde and       
 brother, Dr. Eugene Aug, PhD; and                 
      WHEREAS, we are certain that Ron is          
 looking forward to a well deserved retirement     
 with his family and his many friends.             
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                         
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of              
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our        
 deliberations to congratulate Ronald J. Aug       
 for his many years of service with the City of    
 St. Louis and we wish him peace and               
 happiness in his retirement and we direct the     
 Clerk of this Board to spread a copy of this      
 Resolution across the minutes of these            
 proceedings and to further prepare a              
 commemorative copy to the end that it may         
 be presented to our honoree at a time and         
 place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.          
 Introduced on the 30th day of August, 2012        
 by:                                               
 Honorable Donna Baringer,Alderwoman 16th Ward     
           Resolution No. 119                      
       The 85th Anniversary of the                 
           Casa Loma Ballroom                      
      WHEREAS, we have been apprised that          
 Pat Brannon, owner of the Casa Loma               
 Ballroom is holding its 85th Anniversary on       
 Friday, September 7, 2012; and                    
      WHEREAS, located on the corner of            
 Iowa and Cherokee Streets in the heart of South   
 St Louis, the historic Casa Loma Ballroom is      
 one of America's last great ballrooms and still   
 offers live big band dances every week; and       
       WHEREAS, the Casa Loma first opened         
 in 1927, and was nearly destroyed by fire in      
 1940 and was rebuilt and reopened on              
 November 15, 1940 which was less than a           
 year after the fire gutted the building. The      
 Casa Loma holds just under 1000 people and        
 retains much of its original charm, as well as    
 modern amenities. Ideal for concerts, the Casa    
 Loma features virtually perfect acoustics; and    
      WHEREAS, some of the greatest names          
 in music history have played the Casa Loma        
 including: Frank Sinatra, Ella Fitzgerald, Count  
 Basie, Lawrence Welk, Tony Bennett, Glenn         
 Miller, Tommy Dorsey, Henry James and even        
 rock n roll pioneer Jerry Lee Lewis; and          
      WHEREAS, it is the area's largest dance      
 facility, with a floating dance floor measuring     
 5,000 square feet. Known as "the working            
 man's ballroom" during the 1940's and 1950's        
 an estimated of 10,000 patrons filed through        
 the Casa Loma's doors every week to dance           
 to the sounds of live music; and                    
       WHEREAS, it also hosted the Miss              
 Casa Loma Bathing Beauty Contest from just          
 after WWII through the 1950's and was the           
 primary setting for former St. Louis Post-          
 Dispatch columnist Elaine Viets' mystery            
 novel, Rubout.                                      
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                           
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of                
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our          
 deliberations to congratulate and recognize the     
 85th Anniversary of the Casa Loma Ballroom          
 and we further direct the Clerk of this Board       
 to spread a copy of this Resolution across the      
 minutes of these proceedings and to prepare a       
 commemorative copy to the end that it may           
 be presented to our honoree at a time and           
 place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.            
 Introduced on the 7th day of September, 2012        
 by:                                                 
 Honorable KennethA. Ortmann,Alderman 9thWard        
 Honorable Lewis E. Reed, President, Board ofAldermen
 Honorable Charles QuincyTroupe,Alderman 1stWard     
 Honorable Jennifer Florida,Alderwoman 15th Ward     
 Honorable Dionne Flowers,Alderwoman 2nd Ward        
 Honorable Donna Baringer,Alderwoman 16th Ward       
 Honorable Freeman Bosley, Sr.,Alderman 3rd Ward     
 Honorable Joseph Roddy,Alderman 17th Ward           
 Honorable Samuel L. Moore,Alderman 4th Ward         
 Honorable Terry Kennedy,Alderman 18th Ward          
 HonorableTammika Hubbard,Alderwoman 5thWard         
 Honorable Marlene E. Davis,Alderwoman 19th Ward     
 Honorable Kacie StarrTriplett,Alderwoman 6thWard    
 Honorable Craig Schmid,Alderman 20th Ward           
 Honorable Phyllis Young,Alderwoman 7th Ward         
 HonorableAntonio D. French,Alderman 21st Ward

 Honorable Jeffrey L. Boyd,Alderman 22nd Ward        
 Honorable Joseph Vollmer,Alderman 10th Ward         
 Honorable Joseph Vaccaro,Alderman 23rd Ward

 Honorable Frank Williamson,Alderman 26th Ward       
 Honorable Carol Howard,Alderwoman 14th Ward         
 Honorable Lyda Krewson,Alderwoman 28th Ward         
            Resolution No. 120                       
          Hugh "Peanuts" Whalum                      
      WHEREAS, Hugh "Peanuts" Whalum,                
 a Memphis, Tennessee native has become a            
 legendary fixture in the City of St. Louis as       
 singer, composer, and multi-instrumentalist         
 in pop, swing, jazz, blues and gospel standards     
on piano and tenor saxophone; and                 
     WHEREAS, the work of this legendary          
musical genius, 75-years young, spans decades     
and crosses genres and generations include his    
self-titled debut album "Rendezvous               
Entertainment" produced by nephew, Kirk           
Whalum; and                                       
      WHEREAS, "Peanuts" graduated from           
Vashon High School and attended Wilberforce       
University where he obtained a degree in          
Chemistry and affiliated with Alpha Phi Alpha     
fraternity. He then toured with the Lionel        
Hampton band on tenor sax, played at              
Carnegie Hall with Woody Herman, Billy            
Eckstein, Peggy Lee and Ella Fitzgerald. He       
has played solo piano at countless local hotels,  
theatres and clubs, where he gigged with Miles    
Davis and Ed Thigpen; and                         
      WHEREAS, Alpha Kappa Alpha                  
Sorority, Inc, Gamma Omega Chapter will           
salute Hugh "Peanuts" Whalum during the           
Kirk Whalum and Family Smooth Jazz                
Concert on September 16, 2012, 4:00 P.M. at       
the Sheldon Concert Hall, City of St. Louis.      
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                         
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of              
the City of St. Louis that we pause in our        
deliberations to recognize the achievements       
and accomplishments of Hugh "Peanuts"             
Whalum and we further direct the Clerk of         
this Board to spread a copy of this Resolution    
across the minutes of these proceedings and       
to prepare a commemorative copy to the end        
that it may be presented to our honoree at a      
time and place deemed appropriate by the          
Sponsor.                                          
Introduced on the 7th day of September, 2012      
by:                                               
HonorableAntonio D. French,Alderman 21st Ward     
          Resolution No. 121                      
           CELEBRATION OF THE                     
    50th WEDDING ANNIVERSARY OF                   
      RICHARD & ROBERTA ESKEW                     
      WHEREAS, ROBERTA MARIE                      
LINDLEY AND RICHARD MAYFIELD                      
ESKEW were married on September 15, 1962,         
at North Dupo Bible Church in North Dupo,         
Illinois; and                                     
      WHEREAS, their marriage was the             
culmination of a love affair that began when      
RICHARD and ROBERTA met at the Dutch              
Girl Firemen Dance for the Clinton County         
Fire Department; RICHARD ESKEW was                
the escort for ROBERTA LINDLEY the year           
she was the Firemen's Queen; and                  
     WHEREAS,         RICHARD          and        
ROBERTA ESKEW were blessed with four              
children: Richard Mayfield Eskew Jr. (born        
 May 12, 1963); the twins Connie Roberta           
 Eskew and Bonnie Pauline Eskew Friedmann          
 (born February 24, 1965); and Timothy Paul        
 Eskew (born July 26,1968); and                    
      WHEREAS,            RICHARD         and      
 ROBERTA ESKEW were further blessed by             
 one daughter-in-law, Cheryl Ann Eskew; seven      
 (7) grandchildren: David Anthony Eskew            
 (born July 12, 1984); Bonnie Marie Eskew          
 (born January 3, 1986); Sean Patrick Eskew        
 (born June 23, 1986); Jenifer Rose Friedmann      
 (born August 9, 1988); Julie Anne Friedmann       
 (born May 27, 1990); Timothy Paul Eskew           
 II (born June 1, 1990); Bradley Michael           
 Eskew (born January 6, 1992); and by five         
 (5) great-granddaughters: Hannah Elizabeth        
 Eskew (born September 19, 2005); Holly            
 Dawn Eskew (born January 22, 2008); Haila         
 Marie Eskew (born March 22, 2008); Seryssa        
 Ann Eskew (born April 2, 2009) and Baily          
 Isabella Eskew (born July 5, 2011); and.          
      WHEREAS,            ROBERTA         and      
 RICHARD ESKEW were boy scout troop                
 leaders, volunteered at Meramec Elementary        
 School (2745 Meramec) and each received the       
 Silver Beaver Award at the same time in           
 recognition of their leadership in Boy Scouts     
 of America; and                                   
       WHEREAS, ROBERTA ESKEW                      
 worked for the License Collector's Office of      
 the City of St. Louis for many years and          
 retired a couple of years ago. RICHARD            
 ESKEW also retired, and whiles away his           
 hours doing what he greatly enjoys --             
 FISHING. During ROBERTA's tenure in the           
 License Collectors Office RICHARD ESKEW           
 accompanied her as they both diligently           
 volunteered at election polling locations in      
 Ward 10 (now ward 20) and they religiously        
 attended ward meetings; and                       
      WHEREAS, ROBERTA reportedly still            
 blushes when RICHARD winks at her; and            
       WHEREAS, perhaps part of the success        
 of their marriage can be attributed to the fact   
 they successfully achieved common initials        
 of RME; and                                       
       WHEREAS,          RICHARD         and       
 ROBERTA renewed their vows for their 25th         
 anniversary at the Chapel at the Beamount         
 Boy Scout Camp and will renew their vows          
 for their 50th anniversary at the St. Louis       
 Activity Center (5602 Arsenal) on September       
 15, 2012; and                                     
        WHEREAS, according to our reckoning        
 this September 15, 2012 date is an extra special  
 wedding anniversary celebration for               
 RICHARD and ROBERTA ESKEW because                 
 God has blessed them with 50 years of nuptial     
 bliss.                                            
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                        
 RESOLVED BY THE BOARD OF                        
 ALDERMEN OF THE CITY OF ST.                     
 LOUIS that we pause in our deliberations to     
 recognize the 50th (golden) wedding             
 anniversary of ROBERTA & RICHARD                
 ESKEW and to wish them a HAPPY 50th             
 WEDDING ANNIVERSARY! We wish them               
 many more happy and healthy years of            
 wedded bliss in their retirement. We further    
 direct the Clerk of the Board of Aldermen to    
 spread a copy of this Resolution across the     
 Minutes of our proceedings and to prepare a     
 commemorative copy to the end that it may       
 be presented at a time and place deemed         
 appropriate by the sponsor.                     
 Introduced on the 7th day of September 2012     
 by                                              
 Honorable Craig N. Schmid,Alderman 20th Ward    
           Resolution No. 122                    
       Daryl McKenzie AKA Ninja D.               
       WHEREAS, Daryl McKenzie is one of         
 the top DJs and a producer in the St. Louis     
 area and made a commitment years ago to do      
 what he could to help get young people off      
 the street and into a positive environment;     
 and                                             
      WHEREAS, for the past five years, he       
 has unselfishly devoted his time to act as DJ   
 and Soundman for the "Hot Summer Nights"        
 program, which was created by the               
 Demetrious Johnson Charitable Foundation        
 and WBMS for Kids Sake; and                     
       WHEREAS, even though he is a devoted      
 father and husband, he has taken time out of    
 his busy schedule to make sure that all events  
 were a success; and                             
     WHEREAS, he has never missed a              
 show; never complained and has always           
 maintained a positive attitude; and             
       WHEREAS, he is a great role model for     
 his sons and daughters and no doubt a great     
 role model for the hundred youth that we        
 service for the past five years.                
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                       
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of            
 the City of St. Louis that we pause to          
 recognize the many accomplishments and          
 achievements of Daryl McKenzie to the           
 citizens of the City of St. Louis and we further
 direct the Clerk of this Board to spread a copy 
 of this Resolution across the minutes of these  
 proceedings and to prepare a copy for           
 presentation to the honoree, at a time and place
 deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.              
 Introduced on the 7th day of September, 2012    
 by:                                             
Honorable Frank Williamson,Alderman 26th Ward     
          Resolution No. 123                      
 Courtney Borders a.k.a. KoKo C'Vere              
      WHEREAS, Courtney Borders was               
raised in Pine Lawn and Burd Park in St. Louis    
and has had the longest running single in the     
history of hip hop in the City of St. Louis. He   
is one of the most popular unsigned hip-hop       
artists not only in St. Louis, but also across    
the country; and                                  
     WHEREAS, touring the country as host         
of a "No Bullying" tour, Courtney Borders         
has donated his time and his resources to work    
with youth in New Orleans, Baton Rouge,           
Chicago, and of course in St. Louis; and          
     WHEREAS, ; and or the past five years        
he has unselfishly given of his time as the       
host of program co-sponsored by the City of       
St. Louis Public Safety Director's Office and     
Parks and Recreation entitled "Celebrating        
Our City Youth" ; and                             
     WHEREAS, for the past three years he         
has also hosted Hot Summer Nights, a              
program which was created by the Demetrious       
Johnson Charitable Foundation and WBMS            
for Kids Sake. Not once has he ever turned        
down the opportunity nor has he asked for         
any finances to help work with these young        
people; and                                       
       WHEREAS, he has performed over             
thousand of shows around the country and          
still took the time to host over 60 hot summer    
nights and Celebrating Our City Youth and         
has never missed a show. And times when we        
have questioned the morals and integrity of       
our young man especially in the hip-hop music     
community, what KoKo C'Vere stands out as         
one who has made a positive contribution to       
our community to encouraging young people         
to work together and stay positive and to be      
successful.                                       
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                         
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of              
the City of St. Louis that we pause to            
recognize the many accomplishments and            
achievements of Courtney Borders to the           
citizens of the City of St. Louis and we further  
direct the Clerk of this Board to spread a copy   
of this Resolution across the minutes of these    
proceedings and to prepare a copy for             
presentation to the honoree, at a time and place  
deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.                
Introduced on the 7th day of September, 2012      
by:                                               
Honorable Frank Williamson,Alderman 26th Ward     
            Resolution No. 124                         
   The 100th Anniversary of the Saint                  
               Louis Argus                             
      WHEREAS, The St. Louis Argus was                 
 founded in 1912 by J. E. Mitchell, William            
 Mitchell and Nannie Mitchell-Turner; and              
      WHEREAS, the Saint Louis Argus has               
 the distinction of being Missouri's oldest            
 Black-owned newspaper as well as the oldest           
 African American-oriented newspaper west              
 of the Mississippi River; and                         
      WHEREAS, through the years,                      
 members of the Mitchell Family have provided          
 vision, leadership and business acumen,               
 enabling the Saint Louis Argus to be in the           
 forefront of local news coverage for this             
 community; and                                        
       WHEREAS, the Board of Aldermen                  
 especially recognizes the efforts and                 
 achievements of the late Argus publisher and          
 gifted surgeon, Dr. Eugene N. Mitchell, who           
 passed away on Friday, June 22, 2012; and             
      WHEREAS, the Saint Louis Argus is a              
 treasure within the Fourth Ward.                      
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                              
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of                  
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our            
 deliberations to recognize and honor the 100th        
 Anniversary of the Saint Louis Argus and we           
 wish it continued success, achievement and            
 accomplishment and we further direct the              
 Clerk of this Board to spread a copy of this          
 Resolution across the minutes of these                
 proceedings and to prepare a commemorative            
 copy to the end that it may be presented to           
 our honoree at a time and place deemed                
 appropriate by the Sponsor.                           
 Introduced on the 7th day of September, 2012          
 by:                                                   
 Honorable Samuel L. Moore,Alderman 4th Ward           
 Honorable Lewis E. Reed, President, Board ofAldermen  
            Resolution No. 125                         
           The Banahan Family                          
       WHEREAS, the Banahan family, Mike,              
 Geralyn, Kelly, Kerry and Maggie, is being            
 honored for their dedicated and exemplary             
 service and leadership to their neighborhood          
 of St. Louis Hills and the City of St. Louis;         
 and                                                   
       WHEREAS, in 1991, Mike and Geralyn,             
 working with a small group of community               
 leaders, began planning for a small 5k run with       
 the objective of raising funds for the upkeep         
 and beautification of Francis Park. Despite           
 the early naysayers, the event was a success          
 and enthusiastically accepted in St. Louis            
 Hills; and                                            
       WHEREAS, over the years, the              
 Banahan family added three more run             
 volunteers, their children, Kelly, Kerry and    
 Maggie. The entire family has devoted           
 countless hours and great talent to building    
 the Run for the Hills to the successful event it
 is today. They have volunteered in every role   
 needed for the execution of the event which     
 includes attracting event sponsors, setting up  
 street barricades, working the finish line,     
 organizing and distributing run packets and t-  
 shirts, course set-up and lining up the         
 volunteers; and                                 
       WHEREAS, during the 20 years that         
 Mike and Geralyn have led Run for the Hills,    
 over $200,000 of improvements have been         
 made to Francis and Willmore Parks and          
 thousands of athletes have discovered a true    
 gem in the city- St. Louis Hills. Because of    
 their hard work and help from many              
 volunteers, people are able to enjoy the many   
 amenities of the neighborhood parks. The        
 projects fully or partially funded by the Run   
 for the Hills include new trees, plants, and    
 flowers planted annually, beautiful gardens     
 on the corners and interior of the park, new    
 playground equipment, repairs to the lily       
 pond and the gorgeous lily pond plants,         
 renovations to the handball and racquetball     
 courts, new sidewalks, tuck pointing the steps  
 and bridges in the creek area and adding a part 
 time summer worker at the park. We are          
 thankful to Mike's and Geralyn's vision and     
 dedication over the years which has kept the    
 neighborhood park the beautiful place it was    
 designed to be; and                             
       WHEREAS, the Banahans are                 
 exceptional members of this community           
 whose service to the residents of the St. Louis 
 Hills neighborhood and to all of the citizens   
 of this city is greatly appreciated.            
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                        
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of            
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our      
 deliberations to recognize the Banahan family   
 for their dedication and contributions          
 throughout their community, and we express      
 our best wishes to them for continued success   
 in their future endeavors and we direct the     
 Clerk of this Board to spread a copy of this    
 Resolution across the minutes of these          
 proceedings and to further prepare a            
 commemorative copy to the end that it may       
 be presented to our honorees at a time and      
 place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.        
 Introduced on the 14th day of September, 2012   
 by:                                             
 Honorable Donna Baringer,Alderwoman 16th Ward   
           Resolution No. 126                         
              Emiel Cleaver                           
      WHEREAS, Emiel Davenport Cleaver                
is an accomplished multi media producer with          
over 10 years of production experience; and           
      WHEREAS, Mr. Cleaver will premiere              
his latest endeavor, Freedom is Now: The              
History of Freedom, Incorporated; and                 
     WHEREAS, Freedom is Now is the                   
story of Kansas City's pioneering African             
American political organization; and                  
      WHEREAS, in its infancy, during the             
1960's, Freedom, Inc. developed a reputation          
for shaking up the system, busting up political       
machines in the black community and fighting          
for public accommodations; and                        
      WHEREAS, a highlight of the film is             
the struggles and obstacles that Freedom Inc.         
endured in their beginning days; and                  
      WHEREAS, the film opens with an                 
original gospel tune "Freedom," written and           
performed by the late Michael Charles and             
accompanied by his choir. The film also debuts        
an original rap song "Freedom Tonight,"               
written and performed by Emiel Cleaver; and           
      WHEREAS, not only did Freedom, Inc.             
give many African Americans their first taste         
of politics, but for decades, it tirelessly fought    
for self-determination and equal rights; and          
      WHEREAS, in addition, Mr. Cleaver has           
promoted concerts, organized special events,          
has directed several music videos, a short film       
and several mini documentaries.                       
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                             
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of                  
the City of St. Louis that we pause in our            
deliberations to recognize the hard work of           
Emiel Cleaver and praise the tremendous               
contribution his film will make in our                
community. We further direct the Clerk of this        
Board to spread a copy of this Resolution             
across the minutes of these proceedings and           
to prepare a commemorative copy to the end            
that it may be presented to our honoree at a          
time and place deemed appropriate by the              
Sponsor.                                              
Introduced on the 14th day of September, 2012         
by:                                                   
HonorableAntonio D. French,Alderman 21st Ward         
Honorable Lewis E. Reed, President, Board ofAldermen  
           Resolution No. 127                         
           Deacon Odis Dixson                         
     WHEREAS, we pause in our                         
deliberations to note the untimely passing of         
longtime St. Louis resident, Deacon Odis              
Dixson; and                                           
       WHEREAS, Deacon Odis Dixson was            
 born April 18, 1940 in Tyronza, Arkansas to      
 the union of Jimmie and Bertha Dixson. They      
 both preceded him in death. He was the third     
 oldest of twelve siblings; 7 girls and 5 boys.   
 Five of those siblings preceded him in death;    
 and                                              
       WHEREAS, he was educated in the New        
 Madrid Public School System. He attended         
 and graduated from Libroun High School in        
 June 1960 where he was class president the       
 entire four years; and                           
      WHEREAS, after graduating from high         
 school, he migrated to St. Louis in 1961. In     
 August 1963, he was inducted into the United     
 States Army Corp. After serving 2 years, he      
 was honorably discharged in August 1965; and     
       WHEREAS, on January 29, 1966 he            
 was united in holy matrimony to Rose Carter      
 of St. Louis and to that union one son was       
 born (Lavalle). On January 29, 2006 at a very    
 grand affair, they rededicated their love for    
 each other after 40 years and renewed their      
 vows with the Archbishop Michael A. West,        
 Sr.; and                                         
      WHEREAS, Odis confessed a hope in           
 Christ at a very early age, and was baptized.    
 He also attended the New Mount Zion Baptist      
 Church of Essex, Missouri and the West End       
 Mount Carmel Baptist Church of St. Louis         
 under the leadership of the former Dr. James     
 E. Turner, Sr. Years later, he united with the   
 Family of Faith Baptist Church under the very    
 capable leadership of Dr. William E. Davis;      
 and                                              
      WHEREAS, he was employed as a               
 Supervisor with the St. Louis County             
 Highway and Maintenance Department for           
 36 years and remained there until he retired in  
 May 2002; and                                    
       WHEREAS, he was also Block Captain         
 in the community where he lived and was very     
 active in the neighborhood where he worked       
 with Greg and Chris Carter and Pamela Boyd       
 trying to improve and preserve the community.    
 He was also instrumental in working with the     
 City's Urban League. Odis was admired, loved     
 and respected by many from all walks of life.    
 He knew no strangers and was always willing      
 to lend a helping hand. He was fondly known      
 by many as the "Big O" ; and                     
      WHEREAS, he slipped quietly away            
 from this life to eternity on July 24, 2012 at   
 3:00 p.m. surrounded by his wife, son, and       
 other loved ones at his home.                    
      WHEREAS, He leaves to cherish his           
 loving memorial, his loving and devoted wife     
 of 46 years, Rose; (3) sons, Michael White       
 (Connie) of Sikeston, Missouri, Lavalle Odis     
 Dixson and Quentin Jeffries of St. Louis,           
 Missouri; (1) daughter, Candace Jeffries of         
 St. Louis, Missouri; (3) brothers, Sylvester        
 (JoAnne), Osie Shirley, and Jerry (Ruth)            
 Dixson all of St. Louis, Missouri (4) sisters,      
 Earma Johnson (Kenneth) of Durham, North            
 Carolina, Juanita McConnico (and a very             
 special friend-Horace) of Cape Giradeau,            
 Missouri, Mamie Dixson, St. Louis, Missouri         
 and Lorrene Dixson of Huntsville, Alabama;          
 (9) grandchildren; and a host of nephews,           
 nieces, cousins, and other relatives and friends.   
 Also, two special God daughters, Debra and          
 Rechelle Hadley of St. Louis, Missouri and          
 his loving mother-in-law, Missionary Mae            
 Ann Miller.                                         
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                           
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of                
 the City of St. Louis that we pause to              
 remember the many contributions of Deacon           
 Odis Dixson to the citizens of the City of St.      
 Louis and we join with his many friends in          
 expressing our sorrow at his passing, and we        
 further direct the Clerk of this Board to spread    
 a copy of this Resolution across the minutes        
 of these proceedings and to prepare a memorial      
 copy for presentation to the Dixson family,         
 at a time and place deemed appropriate by           
 the Sponsor.                                        
 Introduced on the 8th day of February, 2008         
 by:                                                 
 Honorable Charles QuincyTroupe,Alderman 1stWard     
 Honorable Dionne Flowers,Alderwoman 2nd Ward        
 Honorable Lewis E. Reed, President, Board ofAldermen
      Unanimous consent having been                  
 obtained Resolutions No. 87 through 127             
 stood considered.                                   
       President Reed moved that Resolutions         
 No. 87 through 127 be adopted, at this meeting      
 of the Board.                                       
       Seconded by Mr. Ortmann.                      
       Carried unanimously by voice vote.            
            FIRST READING OF                         
              RESOLUTIONS                            
       None.                                         
          SECOND READING OF                          
             RESOLUTIONS                             
       None.                                         
        MISCELLANEOUS AND                            
        UNFINISHED BUSINESS                          
       None.                                         
            ANNOUNCEMENTS                            
       None.                                         
          EXCUSED ALDERMEN                           
       Mr. Wessels moved to excuse the               
following aldermen due to their necessary      
absence: Mr. Schmid, Mr. Boyd and Ms.          
Krewson                                        
     Seconded by Cohn.                         
     Carried unanimously by voice vote.        
            ADJOURNMENT                        
      Mr. Wessels moved to adjourn under       
rules to return September 21, 2012.            
     Seconded by Mr. Villa.                    
     Carried unanimously by voice vote.        
     Respectfully submitted,                   
     David W. Sweeney                          
     Clerk, Board of Aldermen                  
  BOARD OF                                     
PUBLIC SERVICE                                 
        REGULAR MEETING                        
 St. Louis, MO - September 18, 2012            
     Board met at 1:45 P.M.                    
     Present: Directors Skouby, Waelterman     
(by phone), Siedhoff and President Bradley.    
     Absent: Directors Bess, Rice-Walker and   
Roth. (excused)                                
     Requests of the Directors of Parks,       
Recreation and Forestry, Health Hospitals and  
Public Safety to be excused from the Regular   
Meeting of September 18, 2012 was read and     
leaves of absence granted.                     
     Minutes of the Regular Meeting of         
September 11, 2012 were unanimously            
approved.                                      
      Communications, reports, recommenda-     
tions and documents were submitted by Board    
Members and action thereon taken as follows:   
         COMMUNICATIONS                        
      Fact and Findings and Conclusion of      
Law for Hearing No. 8152 - Abra Kadabra        
Body Art, to operate a tattoo parlor at 1432   
No. Broadway (3 chairs) pursuant to the        
provisions of Ordinance 57404, codified in     
Chapter 8.97 of the Revised Code of the City   
of St. Louis ordered approved.                 
              PRESIDENT                        
      PSA No. 1125 - Weather Forecasting       
Services, City of St. Louis Street Department  
approved and President authorized to execute   
the same.                                      
     PSA No. 1126 - Open Ended                 
Architectural Design Services at Lambert-St.   
Louis International Airport approved and       
President authorized to execute the same.      
     PRESIDENT AND DIRECTOR                         
           OF STREETS                               
       Application No. 118713, Metro, remove        
 and replace existing concrete sidewalks, install   
 new concrete pads for bus deployed                 
 wheelchair ramps, concrete pads with benches,      
 ADA curb ramps, bus stop sign posts, Braille       
 plates, backfill and seeding and other incidental  
 items at various locations throughout the St.      
 Louis Metro area ordered approved, subject         
 to certain conditions.

      The Board declared as an emergency            
 action abatement of thermal pipe insulation        
 which contains asbestos ordered approved.          
     DIRECTORS OF PUBLIC                            
  UTILITIES AND PUBLIC SAFETY                       
      Application No. 118747, Aquila

 simple townhouse plat at 3850-52 Shaw in           
 C.B. 4949 ordered approved, subject to certain     
 conditions.

      Draft of the following ordinances             
 approved, and the Secretary instructed to          
 forward same to the Board of Aldermen with         
 recommendation that they be passed.                
      "An Ordinance to unconditionally              
 vacate the easternmost 115 feet of the northern    
 15 foot wide east/west alley in City Block         
 4380-E as bounded by Penrose Park (C.B.            
 4379) Euclid, Penrose and Aubert."                 
       "An Ordinance to conditionally vacate        
 1) an irregular portion of 14th Street beginning   
 at Lafayette and extending southwardly             
 432.32' +/- 64.96' to a point and 2) Soulard       
 Street between 13th and 14th Street."              
       "An Ordinance to conditionally vacate        
 an irregular portion of Olive Street adjacent to   
 City Blocks 1042-W and 1057and adjacent to         
 3411 Olive."                                       
       An Ordinance to conditionally vacate         
 the irregular shaped excess portion of Seventh     
 Street beginning at Cerre Street."                 
       2 Permits ordered approved, subject to       
 certain conditions as follows: 118766, Mardi       
 Gras Inc., declare area bounded by So.             
 Broadway on the west side, Marion on the           
 north, the Mississippi River on the east and       
 Russell on the south a festival zone on October    
 6, 13, 20 and 27, 2012 and, 118702, The Ann        
 Avenue Townhouse Association LLC,                  
 encroach with 3 front entries with steps and 4     
 egress windows at 800, 802 and 804 Ann.

 of way by approximately .44 feet (per drawing      
 dated 8/28/12).

 by the Hearing Officer, per Board Order No.     
 766.

         Design Services for                     
         St. Louis City Parks

 participation goals.                            
 PUBLIC NOTICE                                  
     A public hearing will be held by the       
Board of Adjustment at 1:30 p.m. on             
Wednesday, October 3, 2012 in Room 208          
City Hall to consider the following:            
      APPEAL #10051 - Appeal filed by City      
Fish and Chicken, from the determination of     
the Board of Public Service in the denial of a  
request to amend previously issued              
conditional use to allow the Appellant to       
operate a carryout restaurant (no liquor),      
change the hours of operation and to allow      
customers to consume food on the premises       
at 4745 Morganford. WARD 14 #AO496760-          
12 ZONE: "F" - Neighborhood                     
Commercial District BPS118683                   
      APPEAL #10052 - Appeal filed by           
Council Tower Senior Apartments, from the       
determination of the Building Commissioner      
in the denial of a building permit authorizing  
the Appellant to erect two ground signs and     
one wall sign, non-illuminated per plans, at    
314 S. Grand. WARD 19 #AB500368-12              
ZONE: "D" - Multiple Family Dwelling            
District

Towne House Apartments, from the                
determination of the Building Commissioner      
in the denial of a building permit authorizing  
the Appellant to erect one canopy sign, non-

Multiple Family Dwelling District

per plans, at 4600 Chippewa. WARD 14

Commercial District
